Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great central location. Highly recommended for everything. Had a great first time trip to Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: sid c
Reviews.Content: Great place and location. Would defo stay here again. Loved it. Go see it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Great Location!!!Great Price”
Reviews.Author: marny1
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. This is a great hotel with a wonderful location. The hotel is situated between the two Gaudi houses that our a must on anyones list, very close to metro ,and across the street from the city double decker tour. Also, walking distance to the Rambla. The price was 210e per night for a room with two beds. Room was large and airy and light Staff was wonderful. One night they recommended the restaurant across the street (part of the hotel). When my friend and i went in (without reservations) they were reluctant to seat us, but did. We waited fine minutes and no wait staff came, so we left. Upon reporting it to the front desk, the manager sent us a bottle of wine, with a note of apology.. Certainly, above and beyond I would definitely stay at this hotel next time I am in Barcelon

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Keef74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as my company were having an annual conference here. Generally no big complaints. Check in was a bit slow, and also you had to wait quite a while if you wanted to ask anything at reception. I stayed in the older part of the hotel - the hotel is split in two and the other part is across the road - not completely ideal. The room itself was nicely decorated, but a little small, for example you couldn't have the wardrobe door open and walk past, so unpacking your case involves a lot of door opening and closing! Didn't matter too much as I was hardly in there. Bathroom was nice enough too. The restaurant was located in the other building, so you have to dress to go outside to go for breakfast. Breakfast was OK, but not great. As was the evening meal I had there on one occassion - a four course affair. The other nights we went out to one of the many restaurants nearby and had a more enjoyable meal. Location of the hotel is pretty good - near to a metro stop and around 10 mins walk to Placa de Catalunya, so not a bad base to use for sight seeing. As for the hotel facilities, the bar was quite small, the lifts were on the slow side and the internet access in the rooms, whilst free, was very slow - almost to the point of being unuseable. It was better in the conference room which is located on the top floor, along with a rooftop bar and terrace, which was nice and gave good views of the street. There was also a pool up there, but you wouldn't exactly say it was designed for swimming in. It was closed when I was there anyway. Hotel did have a gym, in the other building. To be fair, it was better than I expected, but it was small and just about adequate. Overall, not a bad hotel if you are looking for somewhere with just the essential facilities, but quite possibly there are better hotels close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Eliran M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in amazing location 10 minutes walking away from plasa de cataluniya , next to gaui's museum great st. there is metro next to the hotel and also a tourist's bus station which is the most important , great reasurants to be found around buttom line i strongly recomended this one as well the staff were really kind and helpful enjoy it as we did

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ana Maria A
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful, rooms very modern with everything that we could think of. It is a short walk away from Gaudi's Casa Batllo, la Pedrera and a bit longer to la Sagrada Familia, the location couldn't be better! Within a couple of blocks it has many restaurants to chose from and can't forget to mention that it's in a great shopping area. From now on the place where we'll stay when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrazilFamily4
Reviews.Content: Clean,safe and with great location, helpful and friendly staff. our flight arrived really early and they let us in the room right away! second time here and will stay again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: michelle m Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, I think it's location, room size & service are good. The only problem I had was with the hot water at 4:30 AM (i like to shower when I wake up and I had a very early morning flight to catch) there were no hot water at that time. Other than that everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DoubleRSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 days prior and 2 days after a cruise. We were referred to the hotel by friends who had also stayed there. It's a great location and easy to walk all over Barcelona. We stayed in the building that houses the fitness room. There is a seoncd building directly across the street. The rooms were small compared to the US but clean, well appointed, and modern. We did decide not to eat the buffet breakfast offered and there are several small cafes right around the corner that is much more reasonable. We were also able to arrange transportation from the airport to the hotel and back to the airport at the end of our trip, as we are family of 6, and it worked out very well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: multitrips
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated with a metro station nearby and all the sights within easy reach. The staff in the bar and reception were exceptional - friendly and helpful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay¡¡¡”
Reviews.Author: George A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Condes de Barcelona for three days for business . The satff were attentive and very friendly . Great location. confortable and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleTourman
Reviews.Content: by far the best located hotel for everything, rooms are a little on the cramped side.ie.if wardrobe door is open cant get by the bed...bar drinks extortionate, and was grateful to receive a drinks voucher for the bar( lacking in atmosphere)...however since there were two of us in the room, assumed that if we ordered a round of drinks that the discount would apply....nope...it only applies to one drink.Come on hotel, dont be so mean, and if you want anyone to drink in the bar, make it more affordable!! The concierge was extremely helpful!!...with directions, advice etc etc

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jonny G
Reviews.Content: I go to Barcelona for Business quite often and I stayed in the Condes Hotel for the first time a month ago. This Hotel is basically one of the best Hotels I've been to. The Hotel is like other 4 star hotels: modern, very clean, great breakfast with a huge variety of food to choose from... but what it really makes a difference is the staff of this hotel. They are all so welcoming and friendly making you feel so comfortable... it is unbelievable. I will definitely return to this hotel on my next and future trips to Barcelona! Jonny G

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in perfect city-centre location... I will be returning!”
Reviews.Author: REM-DGRR
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights last week (Sun 29 Jan - Wed 1 Feb) as part of a business trip; I will DEFINITELY be returning in the Spring/Summer with my family! The hotel is very impressive on all fronts: 1. the location is superb (50 yds to the Metro/Renfe station entrances, and right in the middle of Passeig de Gracia); 2. the service is excellent: staff cannot do enough to help - wherever I encountered them (at check-in, in the restaurant etc), they genuinely wanted to help you. Why can't everywhere be like this?!? 3. the rooftop pool/bar area looked like a great place to unwind in the warmer months after some hectic sightseeing - a bit too cold to use on this occasion! 4. My room was both clean and spacious and, most importantly, the bed was very comfortable with bed linen of a very high quality. Looking forward to coming back in the Spring...

Reviews.Title: “short stay, but pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: WinsorTraveler
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at the hotel, but the check in process was easy and the rooms spacious, clean and quiet, not to mention affordable (110EUR). The highlight was the 2 star Michelin restaurant which is well hidden but the wine, food and service were amazing. Portions small but food prepared with complex layers of flavor and incredible creativity.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WeekendGuest
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel - the worst I have stayed in in Barcelona. There seem to be 2 receptions - we went to the wrong one and then had to cross back over the road to a side where the staff were extremely unhelpful and the level of English quite low. They still have smoking floors which absolutely stink - you can smell them from the lift. Room dark and dingy and facing an inner atrium and bathroom dirty and in need to refurbishment Only stay here if everywhere else is full

Reviews.Title: “Water water everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year in a Suite, we had a top floor with a lovely Balcony. The position of Hotel is great. We had booked a suite but did not get exactly what was showed on Photo on website, anyway only there 4 days so didn't complain. The room had the Pod Coffee machine and was given 3 pods in room and I asked for more on 2nd day and charged £1.50 each pod, are we only to have 3 coffees a day! No more. The Staff have to go and sign the Pods from Reception. I really should have Complained but we didn't, lesson learned. We didn't realise we were being charged untill leaving. The room had an extremely shaggy circle rug and I decided to shake it out in the Balcony, used cotton buds and other disgusting things came out which was not ours. We left rug in Balcony. The shower every time we used it flooded, we complained (last straw etc) they told us there was nothing they could do about it but give extra towels. They told us it was the design and build of all the showers and that was that no money returned for hassle. We had to lay 2-4 towels down every time we showered. We paid over £1200 pounds for 4 days and were expecting Quality! We did not get this, a small room with extra bed put in and dirty rug and faulty shower, not including being ripped of for Coffee Pods. And I forgot to say the pool doesn't get heated untill Spring so you can't use pool unless you go in Spring or Summer. We went in April and it was Frozen. My Advice don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and position”
Reviews.Author: Dombrik81
Reviews.Content: I was invited to a business meeting/conference held in this hotel by our partners. The hotel is relatively expensive (I payed 140E per night) but seems reasonable for this price. The position on the Passeig de Gracia on a walking distance from the famous Gaudi's Casas and the Sagrada Familia, also the La Rambla boulevard - almost ideal. Rooms are very wide and comfortable, breakfast is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Design123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel between Xmas and New year 2011 when the pricing was relatively high. We arrived full of expectations because of the excellent reputation, the excellent location right on the Passeig de Gracia in the Eixample and because of the royal associations of the hotel. Our initial reaction was not good at all. The hotel tunred out to be in two buildings on either side of a cross street of the Passeig de Gracia. We went to the wrong one of course and after checking in were offered no assistance to transfer to the other building. Initially the room was 322, surpisingly large for the location but very damaged........the sheers had tears in them, the painting was missing from the wall with the hooks left exposed, the wall mounted TV had been replaced with a deck mounted model and the holes in the wall and brackets just left there, the bathroom had cracked floor tiles and dirty brown stains in the ceiling over the shower. Worst of all it appeared that someone had opened a bottle of cava or something similar and sprayed the wall behind the bed, there were stains running down the wall that the cleaning staff had not noticed and cleaned up. Either someone had recently trashed this room or the maintenance of the hotel is really not up to scratch. I do have photos of all of these points. The morning after check in we complained about the condition of the room and without question were offered an alternative - room 422 - which was generally in much better condition and we were quite happy in this room. Although we were offered an alternative without any fuss both the receptionist and the person who showed us the alternative feined total surprise that we could be unhappy with anything to do with the room despite its very obvious problems. Which raises another point, in contrast to several other hotels where we have stayed in close proximity to this the reception and door staff (on the odd occasion that there was door staff!) were very aloof and superior. Only the bar staff were friendly. So it turns out that the "classic" (read boring late 90s design, not traditional like the style of the exterior of the building nor designerly like many Barcelona hotels) rooms are on one side of the street and the newer modern rooms are on the other side of the street and 21 Euros a night extra. And whilst both buildings have interesting modernist exteriors very little of anything remains in the interiors apart from the entrance hall and stairway in one of the buildings. So overall after the initial change of rooms the room was realtively large, boring in design but adequately comfortable. It would surprise me if these "classic" rooms are not completely made over before long becuase they just don't compete with so many of the hotel rooms in the vicinity or even the ones in the same hotel across the road. The public areas of the hotel and the exterior of both buildings are interesting and really quite lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joahn N
Reviews.Content: Our company stayed at this hotel during our incentive trip to Barcelona. We were very happy with the hotel. The rooms are nice and clean, the location is fantastic and the service was good. And then there is the restaurant, Lasarte, superb! One night a few people in our group had a dinner at the hotel’s restaurant: it was simply over the top! Amazing and absolutely one of the highlights! Remember to use the hotel’s terrace on the roof! You have beautiful views over the city and can even see Gaudís La Pedrera.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location but service is effortless”
Reviews.Author: Tozza_Alta
Reviews.Content: Second time in this hotel and kinda disappointed. Rooms are ok and it is a good value for money mainly due to the great location on Paseig de Gracia, but the service does not seem to care so much about their customers. They are physically present behind the desk, but it stops here. It seems that they are breathing boredom. If you go to Barcelona for a short weekend and do not plan to spend too much time at the hotel, it'll be alright. If not, i'm sure you can pick a better place where the service will show you a more positive and customer focused attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Careful with the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: sgjsn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times -all on business trips where the hotel was booked for me. In fact, there are many meetings held here, and so you might find yourself surrounded by a large group of businessmen - not necessarily a bad thing -but just be aware. The two lifts are small and infrequent, and so you may have to wait a long time - which is annoying if you are on the top floors. The location is great for seeing Barcelona -you can reach most of the central sights by foot -including the Gaudi cathedral. Very near to a metro line , which is also a bonus. Rooms are fine -just try to get one facing the courtyard at the back -the ones to the front can be noisy. Biggest disappointment was the breakfast -17€ for a very poor selection - definitely not worth it. I didn`t bother after the first morning.

Reviews.Title: “City break to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel , ideally situated for enjoying Barcelona. Booked as a last minute break for a couple of days. Stayed in newer section and was perfectly happy with room, service and facilities. Staff were pleasant, would stay again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, "new" side of the hotel OK, quite a bit of noise from traffic”
Reviews.Author: Dillonfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: I travel to Barcelona frequently for work. This was my 3rd stay at the hotel, and each time has been in the "new" building. The standard rooms in the "new" part of the hotel are well priced (130-140 euro per night). Standard rooms are adequate, with good beds and basic amenities but the rooms on the street side are quite noisy due to traffic. The sound proofing on windows seems poor. Breakfast was quite good. Minor gripe - it was frustrating not to be able to easily find a power point in the room for laptop/blackberry/mobile - I had to move side tables, desk and unplug the lamps just to find one accesible power point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: sylvia547
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the older part of the hotel are beautiful. The newer section of the hotel, which is directly across the street has much smaller rooms without character. I stayed in the older section. The room was large, clean, and had a balcony overlooking the street. There were two sets of balcony doors (one inside, one outer) so there was no road noise. The desk staff and doormen were very accommodating. One doorman, Alex, was wonderful. He spoke very good English, was friendly, and very helpful with tourist information. A taxi stand is right outside the hotel so it is very easy to get a ride. The hop-on-hop-off tourist bus has a stop two blocks from the hotel. The neighborhood felt very safe. I did not mind walking alone during the evening. Many good restaurants within easy walking distance. Tip: The rooftop lounge is not very nice. The waiter was rude and it was unimpressive. Much better places to get a drink, tapas, and relax. When back in Barcelona, I will definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: FSdA
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, confortable rooms and good infra-structure. Steps away from metro station. Walk distance to Plaza Catalunia. It is a very good option for you to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: pumba8
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel made what might have been an okay stay very unpleasant. our travel agent booked us a suite at our request and we were initally thrilled when we entered the room, Huge and facing the street with great view. That was the problem.! No sound proofing and lots of motorclycles wizzing by. The desk staff was extremely unhelpful about a room change and I ultimately called our travel agent who is based in Spain for assistance, They called and Immediately the manager came up and he was very accomodating. We decided to try it for the nite(staying 4) because there were no other suites available and he asurred us we could change to a regular room anytime we liked. after a sleepless nite decide to make the change and again the desk staff was very unhelpful. Finally got it done and the room was very small, deary and overlooking some ugly view..The reception staff throughout the four days ,acted as if it was a huge effort to look up and respond to simple questions about a restaurant, directions etc. We were in the old building and breakfast was across the street in the newer one. breakfast buffet pretty bleak and not particularly fresh. location was very good but i would think there are a lot of better choices in the area. We wound up on the fifth floor and though many elevators in spain are tiny and rumbly this one was the worse. and I oftened walked the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Disc29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights (at the Monument building - not sure if that is the old or the new). The location is great for walking around and shopping at high end designer stores. It is true that if you open a window, all the street traffic noise makes sleeping difficult. I had to close the window and turn on the air conditioning to get some peace and quiet. The room was decent in size for 1 person. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. I ordered room service one evening and the food was pretty good (tuna on green salad and chocolate cake). The breakfast was included in my corporate rate and was handled by the restaurant across the street. Probably not the most convenient, but it was doable. The breakfast selection was fairly good, although nothing to get excited about. Overall, I would say it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They can't help it, but great location”
Reviews.Author: kidrid
Reviews.Content: We booked here on the suggestion of a friend. We changed rooms twice. The good points are the location which resembles Madison Avenue with lots of high end stores (a lot of which you will not see in the states) and awesome food choices at multiple places just out the door. It is far enough away from the Ramblas area, which is a bit of a madhouse. The Hotel is in two buildings, formerly mansions of some sort, I think. The place is handsome and clean. The lobby bar is pricey and boring, so I would go elsewhere given so many choices. They have a large, open terrace cocktail area on the 8th floor in the opposite building that gives an awesome view of the Sagrada Familia Cathedral. After you get your first drink, however, they basically forget about you. So expect to get up and find your server. You can't sit at the bar itself which is for servers. So why am I down on this place? Expect any room facing the street (and this is a corner property) to yield lots of street noise. It is on the Passeige de Gracia, which is a major thoroughfare).That basically eliminates half the rooms. The ones facing their inner courtyard are much quieter. Also, you can hear the subway rumble underneath constantly. Being on the higher floors does not eliminate the problem because low frequencies travel. So if you wake up in the middle of the night or are a light sleeper, you may be upset. We had to change rooms twice. In our third room, we were able to hear foot traffic on the stair case that abutted it outside. Oy vay. TV and movie selections were poor to fair. We saw so many other hotels in the immediate vicinity that I would consider looking elsewhere. It's a shame because the place is otherwise ok. That's why I gave it an average rather than very good rating.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer older building to the newer building”
Reviews.Author: paa9
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Condes De Barcelona for one night before departing on a cruise. This was our second visit to the hotel. First time (2 years ago) we stayed in the old building. This time we stayed in the new building. We found we actually prefer the old building. It has more charm and the lobby is larger. Rooms in both buildings are the basically the same. Ours had plenty of room, a very comfortable bed, and, most importantly, cool air conditioning. Both buildings have roof top lounges and you can enjoy the views without having to buy drinks. The entire staff was friendly and accomodating. For example, we arrived early morning and wanted a room asap to sleep after a long overnight flight. We were quickly checked in, which we greatly appreciated. The hotel is on the Paseo de Gracia and the location is wonderful. Plenty of restaurants and shops within close walking distance. There is a cab stop in front of the hotel, which we liked. Definitely would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Chap
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel. It was booked through Royal Caribbean-we stayed one night before cruise. When we checked in,I gave them the voucher from the cruise line-the man stated,oh, you'll be in the hotel across the street-I don't know what the difference is, but from reading reviews I knew that wasn't the preferred location, but for 1 night I didn't ask if anything was available in the main hotel. The next morning I called for a hair dryer(never received it) & asked about shuttle to the ship-I was told luggage needed to be put out immediately & we needed to be on bus at 10:30(it was now 9:50!!)-They asked if I received welcome packet from front desk when we checked in-we didn't receive it-word of warning-if you stay here before cruise, be sure to ask for welcome packet. Overall I wasn't impressed for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: judygCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I spent three nights before boarding a cruise ship. Not a new building but a very nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, central Barcelona hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: The Condes De Barcelona is actually split over two buildings, we were in the original 'Condes' side, I think the others building, on the direct opposite corner, 30 seconds away, is the 'Comtes'. It is a fine hotel, both buildings have small swimming pools with bars and food available, although at the time of our visit work was being done on our side so no drink or food were available. The newer 'Comtes' side has the better bar open late into the night and with wonderful views of the Casa Mila and Segrada Familia. Set on the Paseo de Gracia the location couldn't possibly be better, shops and sights within walking distance or even nearer. We have visited this hotels a few times in the past, though not to stay, and the staff levels seemed to have been cut back somewhat, probably understandably in these times, but at no point was there more than one person on reception, which can be a little annoying. Those staff, and all in fact, were helpful and attentive. The room, with a view of the street was lovely although, maybe another money saving scheme, toiletries were a bit spare, two people showering twice a day need more than one tiny bottle of shower gel. And very surprisingly, for a hotel of this quality, no slippers or bathrobe. Very happy to say Wi-Fi was free, as it should always be. Our bed was marvelously comfy with great thin quilt. Extra pillows are available on request. We have eaten at the Lasarte restaurant on another visit and it is very good, this time we didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on food. Snacks by the pool were very good. So a good hotel, seemingly saving the pennies. I would recommend it primarily for it position at the heart of the city but away from the noisy and frankly horrid Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the hotel is not 5stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: mbanderson
Reviews.Content: There are so many new and better hotels. This property owns 2 hotels and is overrated. They both have outdoor pools - small but nice after a day out. The room I had this trip was dark, noisy not worth the upgrade. If you get a great price - less than 120 euros - okay - but not worth 200 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location with Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohannad F
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife for our honeymoon trip, first, the location is very ideal, it is close to everything' stores, market, bus. You can enjoy the walk in the near area during the evenings. So, first, I love it because of the location. The hotel itself is nice, clean but you feel it small. the rooms are nice, clean with small balacony but still you can enjoy it. The service is excellent, they are helpful and friendly. Breakfast is normal. Gym is normal, The roof bar is nice with stunning view but you need to order to sit. All over, I would try it again, and recommend friends to use it, with possibility to find better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fatpup
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed here at the end of July this year. I booked using Trivago Website ( I would also highly recommend this, we got a fantastic room rate.) On arrival we were offered an upgrade to an executive room for 21Euros per night ( it is usually 81 Euros per night to upgrade to this room). The reception staff were very helpful and friendly, and showed us up to our room. The room itself was fantastic, a huge room in fact with a large dressing area with wardrobes and full length mirrors. The bathroom was nicely done and the shower was amazing.. Spacious and powerful. Bath robes ( albeit very large ones.. and i'm only 5ft1) were provided as were all the toiletries. The bed was incredibly comfortable and very big... the room had full patio windows all across with motorized shutters for privacy. The view from our room was into the centre of the courtyard, which wasn't an amazing view to be honest. So if you are staying maybe ask for a road side view. The location of this hotel is perfect, situated on the Passeig de Gracia, a stones throw away from Gaudi's famous buildings. The roof top bar, Alaire, has great views across the city to the Sagrada Famillia, and their "patatas Bravas" is to die for. We spent a week here, we hired a motorbike to get us around the city and to make the journey to the beach easier ( this hotel is roughly 3 miles from the beach). Worth a visit is the Tibidabo Mountain. We rode the bike as far as we could and then took a ride on the Funiculor tram that takes you to the top. The view from up there is incredible, you can see all across Barcelona. And the Church is beautiful. There's a funfair at the top that's over 100 years old! We discovered several restaurants this time in Barcelona and think it's worth mentioning a few of them as the are down side streets and possibly wouldn't be found normally. ( we discovered them whilst riding around on the bike. La Tagliatella on C/Mallorca is a lovely quaint italian, the food was lovely... especially the Pizzas! The staff were very friendly too. If you like Indian food then head to Mayuna, on Calle Girona. The food was possibly the best Indian food I have ever eaten and the setting is beautiful. I would recommend this hotel, The only thing wrong with our stay was that the rooftop pool area wasn't open ( Maintenance) but as the hotel is on two sides of the road occupying two buildings, there is another roof top pool that we could use.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but the location was great and enjoyed the rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: SFKevin
Reviews.Content: My honey and I stayed for three nights and upon check in, we were upgraded to a Condal room by the front desk. The room was spacious and the bathroom was huge. The shower had jets on the side like a jacuzzi. It was nice to turn on the jets for a few minutes to relax and unwind before getting ready to explore Barcelona's night life. The rooftop pool had a champagne bar and city views; I wish the pool was bigger, but we stil enjoyed it. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Gaudi house and lots of shopping nearby. There is a great Chinese fusion restaurant a block away; the food was delicious. I would definitely stay here again if I received a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Barcelona, NOT for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: luckycharns
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our European honeymoon. The location is ideal! It was in a really safe area(a Louis vuitton store across the street definitely helped) and right in between 2 metro stops. The rooms were nice and adequate. They were clean but had a funny smell to it. Our stay was overall good because of the area. The service was also a mix...the good was the maids and bellhops. The bad was the front desk gentleman. He was incredibly rude and really tried to make you feel stupid for not knowing the policy of the hotel (the whole reason for calling downstairs to ask questions). We would stay here again but will look at other options since we have a better feel for barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leathelweapon13
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be modern, clean and the rooftop was amazing. We spend each evening on the rooftop enjoying the great views and sunset. The location was really convenient to all site seeing venues. We walked to all our sites. The service was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Barcelona....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amatos391
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Condes de Barcelona Hotel and our experience was very good. Location is perfect! Situated in Paseig de Gracia Avenue, almost in front of Gaudi’s famous La Pedrera, in one of the best neighborhoods in Barcelona, close to shops, boutiques, restaurants, Touristic Bus stop and Metro Station. Spacious room and the most comfortable bed we had in Europe. Very nice hotel and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Cold water, Poor customer service, could do much better”
Reviews.Author: MrsMessy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here post cruise, but the only thing going for this hotel is the location. When we arrived we discovered that building work was going on so there was no restaurant or even a toilet! We were told that we would have to have breakfast in the hotel across the road! The room was fine at first, quiet, flat screen TV, small terrace balcony. However, the safe didn't work. We asked reception to fix it but they coudn't because 'maintenance weren't working'. The safe wasn't fixed in the three days we were there. The water in the bathroom was cold, both for a bath and a shower. I phoned reception who told me that thye water came from a tank on the roof and would take 10 minutes to run warm. After waiting 20 minutes I gave up and had a cold bath. Same the next day for a shower. The breakfast room across the road was windowless and soulless. The staff said hello at the door and then didn't come anywhere near you again. The hotel across the road had a roof terrace which has good views across the city. However, the first day we used it was lunchtime, completely empty but they wouldn't let us sit on the comfy sofas, but perch on little bar stools! Ridiculous! The second day we went up there they were reserving seating for people to watch a football match and wouldn't let guests sit on comfy seats. We complained to reception who said that the terrace wasn't just for hotel guests!! On the second day one of the towels left in our room was filthy so I took it down to reception to get it replaced. The most rude receptionist said I shouldn't have brought it down but phoned and he just threw it on the floor! It wasn't replaced. Barcelona is beautiful and we would visit the city again, but now we've been there we can see there are much better choice of hotels. Please don't stay here. You will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: VacantVacations
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Best location for checking out the gaudi buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Staceyu1507
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Condes De Barcelona for 3 nights at the beginning of August. I have been to Barcelona before but in the winter months. I was attracted to this hotel as it is in a great location, had modern rooms, great bathrooms, swimming pool and a roof terrace. I was not disapointed by this hotel. The rooms were great. Lovely modern interior with fantastic bathroom which was very spacious and modern. My room had a lovely balcony that I thoroughly enjoyed spending time on each morning. The roof terrace is wonderful. I can not say enough good things about it - the view is breath taking, drinks were fantastic and we even had an oyster specialist spend time with us talking about eating oysters. Beware the drinks are quite expensive but the view makes it very worth spending the little bit extra. If you want to offset these expensive drinks there's a great little tapas bar next door that serves the biggest liquer measures I've ever seen for very cheap prices. I was however dissapointed by the maintenance being under taken on the pool which meant it could not be used. The pool facilities were the main thing that lead me to stay in this hotel so it was really frustrating that maintenance was going on. The key thing was that I was not notified prior to my stay that these refurbishments were taking place. If I had been I may not have chosen to stay in this hotel. That said I would then have missed out on the fantastic roof terrace. If you want a pool and are due to stay I'd suggest a quick call to the hotel. Top Tip - Go to the W resort in Barceloneta for fantastic watermelon martini's and the best view in Barcelona. Expensive but very very worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: NMSheffield
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with a friend in July. As we had been to Barcelona many times before we specifically booked this hotel for the pools as we anticipated spending time around them. Unfortunately when we arrived we were advised that 1 of the pools was closed as it was having work done. When we went up to the deck of the other pool we were told, by a very rude woman, that it was 'private' and we couldn't use it. Essentially the area had been give over to a furniture convention for the weekend. The guests could use an area approx 6m square. This was ridiculous, a lot of guests were unhappy and complaining, people camped out on any space around the pool they could squeeze into. We complained but the front desk were completely unconcerned, when we asked to speak to the duty manager we were told that there wasn't 1around for the next 2 days!? The bottom line was we were paying for facilities we couldn't use. Trying to get a drink (ie spend money) around the pool was difficult nobody answered the phone there to call the bar you could be hanging on for 10 minutes before anyone picked iup. The room was nice, location good as was breakfast. However we stayed at Hotel 1898 last year and would highly recommend. Staff at this hotel did not go the extra mile and clearly were not bothered about giving guests good service and therefore ensuring repeat business. Don't stay here there are far better in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A HONEST HOTEL IN THE CENTER OF BARCELONA”
Reviews.Author: psychoAthens
Reviews.Content: We stay at hotel 3 nights.The room are OK, the breakfast was exellant and the roof garden is Amazing!!!! Nice view to La Pedrera and all over Barcelona.Its only 15min walk from Las Rablas.

Reviews.Title: “Well, It's Depand If you fall on the Right Building...”
Reviews.Author: MUKY100
Reviews.Content: Let me just said that to all of you that write down that its a terrible hotel, its really not acuurate. the hotel has two building. the main building have updated room, the other building has small reception , and old room. we were very lucky , we first stay in the clean but old room ( not updated , noisy,, , very old tv , old furtinture , old tub...like 3 starts hotel) but after we found that the hotel decide to reconstruct the room near us... we moved to the main building to update room , very nice decorated, with big tub , personall shower , a private nesppresso machine!! New LCD TV , king size bed ' Big Closet! its really turn our holiday 180 Degrees. thr breakfast is great. varient and high quality product. the staff are polite, helpfull and know english well. it has very small swimming pool on the roof. the location is great , just 10 minutes walk or 1 metro station to Plaza Catlonya and the rambllas. the hotel located on The passage De Garcia, very Luxuarry Strret withh a lot of expensive Shops (Armany , VITON , LOEWE , BOSS ,,,,) so let me summerize. the hotel is expensive , for this price persist on an update room!! (in the main building) otherwise i would go to a cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. Love to be back again !”
Reviews.Author: anahelene
Reviews.Content: I reserved a classic room and I really enjoyed the stay. The room was more spacious than I expected. I love the modern and sophisticated decor. My room was faced on the Majorca street but it was sound proof so I could have a good sleep on a very comfy bed. The hotel staff was very helpful. The swimming at night on the roof of Barcelona was also very nice ! I would love to be back again to enjoy the stay at Condes.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ,never return”
Reviews.Author: Love112710
Reviews.Content: We ended our honeymoon here, the rooms are a joke . We looked at an upgraded room and could not see the difference. The staff was rude and could not answer any questions about the hotels ammenities. Our room waste basket was not emptied for days and our bedding was stained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Lexi110
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here for a couple of nights toward the end of June...the hotel is pretty nice but expensive ($400 per night when we stayed including breakfast). The room had a nice view over the Passeig De Gracia with a floor to ceiling window that opened a crack over a faux balcony. The bathroom was a tad shabby, chipped tub with poor drainage and old fixtures, but clean, fabulous towels. Bed was very comfortable with crisp linens. The TV situation was irritating tho! An old dusty small TV partially covered by the curtain that you had to pay to watch. For the price of the hotel TV should be included I would think?! It was 25 euro a day to watch TV and have internet. I was able to get Sky News and BBC news when I kept flicking through the channels. I know I didn't visit Barcelona to watch TV but I like to have the option at night. The pool area is very small but stylish. The upstairs bar I didn't frequent but had a peek and it looked trendy. Breakfast was delicious, nice spread of fresh fruits and meats, breads, cereals etc. Overall, location is excellent, hotel is nice, but on the expensive side for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: joseph99
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before leaving on a cruise. The hotel is in a very nice area of town - close to Sagrada Família and only a block from La Pedrera. The local bus (#24) stops across from the hotel and goes to Park Güell. So, for a Gaudi fan, the location is fantastic. Also, it is close enough to walk to La Rambla, but happily, far enough away from the chaos and criminal element. We were upgraded to an executive room and found it very comfortable, although the cold modern lines of the decor do not match the old world charm of the facade of the Condes.

Reviews.Title: “Would never return to the expensive barren hotel”
Reviews.Author: PPJGPJ
Reviews.Content: For over $600.00 per night we got a barren room with inadequate lighting, no decor and sub-standard in every way. They charged 4 euros for ice to boot! The room had floor to ceiling glass with an electric shade. For privacy from the buildings outside we had to have the shade closed at all times leaving us in the dark. The dirty small balcony had a sliding door that automatically locked from the inside. Someone on the balcony would be trapped if no one else was in the room. There was no light at the desk area and no clock. The bathroom had minimal privacy, with an opaque swinging glass door and an opaque glass wall that abuted the bedroom. When the bathroom light was turned on in the middle of the night it flooded the bedroom. The slate floor made the bathroom cold and noisy as did the wood floors of the bedroom. The toilet paper was out of reach and on an open spool that fell to the floor every time it was used. The furniture was low and uncomfortable and the small shag rug looked like a K-Mart special. The elevators were cramped, hot and very slow. The fire staircase was locked. It took several hours for our bags to get to our room because of understaffing. We paid for location, but the accommodations were not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer (at someone esle's expense!)”
Reviews.Author: Quinbus
Reviews.Content: It's always a pity when you're in a hotel which offers so much that you spend such a short time there. We arrived at 10:00 pm and left at 09:30 the following morning, so all I can talk about is the room, which was excellent, smart, modern, spotlessly clean, with a TV and wifi that actually worked, and a good working-space desk. I did actually stay here a couple of years ago, and it's useful to know that there the hotel has two buildings, one on each side of the Carrer Mallorca junction with the Passeig de Gràcia. They're both the same vintage (about 1900, I'd say), but the southern one (no. 73) has been completely refurbished in the modern style (this visit). If you prefer the more traditional décor, then ask for the northern building (no.75). I should say that I wasn't paying and so can't comment on value for money, but looking at booking.com it does seem a bit pricey. Interestingly, no. 73's fascia has the name 'Comtes de Barcelona' (i.e. in Catalan), while no. 75 has the Castellano 'Condes de Barcelona'. No, sorry, it isn't very interesting after all, is it?

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reaction”
Reviews.Author: gtho82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few days while visiting Barcelona in July 2010. It is a little confusing, because there are two towers across the street from one another: an older building, and an updated one. When we first checked in, they put us in the old building, in a room without a balcony (even though we specifically booked and paid for a room WITH a balcony). When we informed the front desk, they told us it was all booked for the night, and they would switch us the next day (which they did follow through on). Our room in the older tower was large, clean, but dated. We were pretty annoyed that our reservation wasn't respected, and the front desk didn't seem very apologetic about it either. But- our experience in the newer tower was incomparably better. Our room had the balcony we had requested, with a beautiful view of Gaudi's La Pedrera. The room was very nicely decorated, clean, and updated. In addition, the building itself was much more updated. Bottom line: Make sure you get a room in the newer tower, and you'll be happy you did!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little over priced”
Reviews.Author: Keelia111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a wedding. I waws disappointed that I had to pay for WiFi. Rooms are small but clean and nice. English TV channels minimal. Definitely request a room with patio or balcony. Staff was friendly and helpful. Terrace bar/restaurant was excellent! Room had a hair dryer and bed was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: karaluii
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to cruise departure. No complaints about the service AT ALL. The desk allowed us to check in 3 hours early, had great recommendations for dinner on a Sunday when most of the restaurants in Barcelona are closed and held our bags the next day while we did a bit of sightseeing. Reservations were made on-line through the Hotel's website and every request was accommodated (single beds, balcony, etc.) The room was small but modern and no problem for one night. The balcony a real plus (great photos from there, you can see the top of the Sagrada Familias). We would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Polite, but entirely unprepared!”
Reviews.Author: mta65
Reviews.Content: Condes de Barcelona is in a great location and that was why I selected this hotel. As cruise passengers were checking in and out on the day we checked in, they were completely unprepared to deal with the numbers of people. We arrived at 9:30am and of course did not expect a room to be ready. No problem...told it would be ready at 2:00pm. We returned and the place was still a mess and entirely covered up with people standing in line and all over the tiny lobby area. Our room was not ready and we were told we would have to wait an undetermined amount of time. I indicated that this was unacceptable as I had prepaid this room and expected to be able to check in by check in time. We were given a room. The room was sparse but clean and a lovely view....then 1 hour and 40 minutes later after complaining twice we finally got our luggage. I begged them to let me just bring it up myself and was told "no, we don't have the key". I was beginning to get worried as we hadn't seen the luggage for about 6 or 7 hours....My husband went down then and finally our luggage arrived. The staff was generally polite, but they were just unstaffed and unprepared for the number of people coming and going. Wouldn't stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Saffy101
Reviews.Content: As soon as I entered the room, I knew it was perfect. Spare modern design inside the room resonated with the old-world beauty of the corridors and the inner courtyard. My room had French windows and a Juliet balcony which overlooked the passing parade on the Passeig de Gracia but it was not noisy even with the window open. The bathroom had a bidet, first time I ever used one. The little cafe/bar in the lobby provided a quiet refuge for a coffee or a coke. The hotel is quiet even though it is very centrally located on the fashionable Passeig de Gracia. All in all, a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, confortable, but prefer the "old" building”
Reviews.Author: The_Attorney
Reviews.Content: Its is my 3rd stay at Condes de Barcelona, the location the best for shopping, restaurants and visits ! The hotel is confortable, but I advise the "old" building (renovated) bacause the rooms are more spacious and with better amenities. The swiming pools evendough very small (at the top of both buildings) are a great "plus" in the center of Barcelona, also with a nice bar near the swiming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: StevoA
Reviews.Content: Never disappointed staying in Barcelona, Hotel Condes de Barcelona was no exception, cab ride from Barcelona Airport came out to around 20 Euro, check-in was a breeze, room had a very spacious and modern feel, hardwood floors in the room and slate in the restroom, very comfortable bed, push button electronic curtains that led out to your private balcony. The top deck lounge had a great view of the city, including the Sagrada Familia. Wireless internet was a 6 Euro charge for 24hrs. One of the best things about the hotel is the location, close to everything that’s worth seeing and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: olik_plavnik
Reviews.Content: Great location, we had a Casa Mila view from our room. Breakfast was fantastic We am very pleased with my hotel choice and higly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Nice but quiet expensive”
Reviews.Author: Nexis69
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great location however is very expensive. If your looking for a place near Gaudi's buildings and shopping areas, then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great location and high value”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: It's hard to get this kind of value during high season in Barcelona. Perfect location. Perfect weather. Perfect service. Perfect Room (in the new building). Yes, the pool is closed temporarily but we weren't going to use it anyway. Our room wasn't ready for very early check-in (no surprise) so we walked around the city for 4 hours, came back and they surprised us with a room upgrade to Executive Suite, with a huge terrace. How fantastic! Initially I was concerned about possible noise from traffic but the terrace doors are so sound-proofed that you can't hear a thing! Honest! We took afternoon naps, no noise. Late wake up, no noise. It was heaven. The terrace at sunset is wonderful, albeit a tad pricey for drinks. We didn't do breakfast because of the other reviews about cost. Instead, I went across the street to Jamaica Coffee for a splendid coffee with milk and croissant for 2 Euros. Can't beat that. Front desk service was outstanding. They got us into Da Greco Italian Restaurant, just up the street, a superb experience. Kudos to Condes de Barcelona. We can't recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kev_D13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary. From the initial welcome right through to departure every staff member was polite & helpful. The rooftop terrace was fantastic, despite being extremely busy, the staff were rushed off their feet but they managed to serve everyone with such professionalism. It's a great location for exploring the heart of this fabulous city and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ddstrachan
Reviews.Content: Condes de Barcelona is a comfortable hotel with lovely roof top terraces with views of Passig de Gracia. The rooms vary in size and style from traditional to modern. Our room was a traditional one with a view over the interior witha very comfortable bed. The staff is helpful and friendly. From the hotel, you can walk to many of the key tourist sights. The neighborhood has many high end stores, cafes and restaurants. The two restaurants (Lasarte and Loidi) in the hotel are outstanding....run by a Michelin chef.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: gitsmuts
Reviews.Content: this hotel is ideally located across from La Pedrera and is walking distance to ramblas with lots of shopping opportunities in between. they have the hop on hop off bus tour stops right in front of the hotel. the rooms are very comfortable with modern interiors. the reception/ concierge is well informed. they are clued in about most city info.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great Location & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DeeSean
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 3 months in advance having be very overwhelmed at the choice of Hotels available - it was for my partners special birthday and it was perfect! We initally had book a standard room which was very quiet and clean but I just thought it was a bit cramped so we upgraded to an exectuive room which was fab! The beds, in both rooms, were so comfortable, the hotel is spotless, the staff on reception and in the bar could not have been nicer. The hotel is divided between new and old and the pics on the website can be a bit confusing. Breakfast was good, included in our price but not sure it's worth €19 per head extra, there is such good value in food all around. The pool was closed due to time of year but looks amazing - cocktails in the roof top bar a great start or finish to any night. Right beside the Metro and 10 mins stroll to La Rambla.... Just Fab!

Reviews.Title: “Promising more than it delivered”
Reviews.Author: ScientistUK Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Condes De barcelona was sitauted in a really great location to explore the city of Barcelona. I was visiting for business meetings so booked the hotel well in advance as this was also the hotel where the 4 day meeting was to be help. I moved room having been placed on the street side of the newer hotel building which was very noisey - wanting to rest as much as possible. Moving rooms was not a problem and the staff were accommodating. Rooms are fairly generous in size, however, for a newer hotel room and building I found the rooms shabby with scratched wooden floors and wardrobes. The design is minimalist but looked tired to me! I had a design delux room - which had a small balcony overlooking a courtyard a nice thoughtbut lack of shuttes made this far from private. The bed was 2 twins pushed together - not ideal if you are a couple - I found the lack of tea/coffe making facilities annoying espceially if you want a coffee in the morning to wake up. The breakfast was really expensive (unless you have included this in your room rate) 20 euros for a buffet! Also the internet charge of 16 euro per day for wifi is ridiculous as was teh use of a computer in teh lobby for 10 minutes 2 euro. The additional costs which neccesitate business (internet, coffee making and breakfast charges) make this hotel far from it's 4 star rating and extremely expensive to stay here. The roof top bar which opened during the week of my stay in March was nice but again promising much more than it delivered. I would rate this as a 3 star hotel max for accommodation with a 5 star price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Sweat!”
Reviews.Author: heiranig
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Condes de Barcelona. My room # 569 was beautiful and huge for a big city and so was the bathroom with double sinks, lots of counter space, gorgeous modern faucets and rain shower head, extra-thick towels, etc… The only weird detail was the curtain: it was a white cardboard-type screen that only covered half of the window so I felt like other rooms across could see me as I could see them. Breakfast was very nice, with a good choice of cold and hot items at the buffet, and set in a comfortable and stylish dining room. The location was excellent: in the misdt of THE shopping street of Barcelona and a 15mn walk from Placa Catalunya where one could catch the Aerobus to the airport for euros 5.60. Definitely worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: safaris63
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on monday evening, showed to our room, lovely,clean. Great location..... walk everywhere we wanted to, beautiful hotel, stunning location, could not have bettered if we had paid 4 times the price...definately coming back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redwallguy
Reviews.Content: I had book an executive room and really could not have been happier. The room was a great size, had a good size desk, free internet and had a lovely balcony too. The bathroom was a very good size and really enjoyed the deep bath. Separate rain shower and double sinks. Bed was very comfortable, staff were very friendly and is next door to a GREAT tapas restaurant. Could not fault this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time - love it”
Reviews.Author: birdwins
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here in June 2009, August 2010 and Feb 2011. Great each time. Nice rooms, great staff, unbelievable location, wonderful rooftop bar. Only complaint - they need to do real free Wifi. They offer one free password per day - this is antiquated and not commercial. Most people travel with multiple devices, my husband and I each have a laptop and my son stayed with us with an iPad - if the Hotel wants to use security for their network, which I understand, there should be a single password for the day for all guests, and it should be FREE. Get with the program. Nonetheless, I love this hotel and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Boo2211
Reviews.Content: I couldn't praise this hotel enough. It combines every element needed to enjoy a trip away. It's location was brilliant, close walk to shops and to various subway's to get further afield. Many famous sight seeing opportunities lay right on your doorstep too, with those out of reach a short underground journey away. In regard to the hotel and it's sister hotel opposite, it was lovely. There is a choice of two pools, one on each rooftop which we found great, but also a rooftop terrace, bar (called Alaire) and a jacuzzi. These facilities were never over run with people or ridiculously busy so you could really spend time to enjoy them. The bedroom and bathroom facilities were also spotless, and very comfortable making our stay even better. Included in our deal, we also had breakfast which was lovely...there is nothing like spanish tortilla to set you up for the day! The breakfast is provided in the hotels restaurant located next door to the hotel and this was something to look forward to every morning! I can't compliment this hotel enough, Barcelona is an amazing city and this hotel does it justice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but it's not all that”
Reviews.Author: DucksManchester
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on the rooms at this hotel and, therefore, it was worth what we paid for it. However, I would have been dissapointed if we had payed full price for this. We went in january which I know is not in season however, the terraces were closed and the pools were not open. They were also doing refurbishment works to one of the terraces, none of this was really communicated until you checked in. The room was a reasonable size as we had one at the end of a corridor and the bed was comfy. The bathrooms however, need some updating, they were tired and not in the best condition. Also be warned if you stay on the front of the hotel, the spanish like to beep their horns and this can be disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're only looking for spending nights.”
Reviews.Author: BirabanoR
Reviews.Content: We've been to Barcelona for the first time with my wife at September'10 and our only need was a perfectly located hotel with good rooms. Yes, this hotel the one we were looking for. We spent our time mostly exploring the city so a hotel like our apartment was good enough for us. The Hotel is not a highly-polished touristic place and gives you a feel that you're returning your home after a long and tiring day. We stayed at a business room which is large enough and very clean. Sleep quality was fantastic and I fell in love with the pillows and the puff :) The staff is always there to help you but you don't see their presence if you do not want to, which is nice to me. The most important advantage of The Hotel is its location, I have to underline it, be aware the hotels near La Rambla. Too much touristic and not appropriate for people like me who do want to live the city like a local. That's why The Hotel's location is magnificent, you're close to the heart of the city but not bothered by the chaotic surroundings. The another plus is their 2 special restaurants which is blessed by a 2 Michelin starred chef Martín Berasategui. You must experience his courses. To sum up, do not hesitatate to book a room from Condes de Barcelona if your only goal is to explore the city and want a good room to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky modern hotel, good service, good for high end shops”
Reviews.Author: 52traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here New Years Eve and Day so that we could dine at Lasarte. This hotel is actually two buildings on opposite sides of the street, and we were a little taken aback when we checked in with big suitcases to be told that we had to walk across the street to the other building (no sign of a porter). Still it was NYE and pretty chaotic. We took a Design room - really nice, great bed, electric blockout blinds, and a proper separate shower in a a very cool bathroom. Dinner at Lasarte was superb. On the second night we returned to our room after dinner to find water dripping through the bathroom ceiling and flooding the floor. After a bit of mucking about we were moved to a small suite (we did the moving). Best hotel breakfast of the trip. On the whole really good hotel, but a bit disorganised at times and signs of poor fitout quality so it might age quickly

Reviews.Title: “Average in great location”
Reviews.Author: ryevrah
Reviews.Content: We went on the high recommendation of a friend. We got stuck in a room right near the service elevator and housekeeping center — even though we'd reserved six months in advance. The room was very nice, but wifi ought really to be free — given the hotel's aspirations. And the "business center" was a joke. Overall, this looks like a hotel that is on the decline.

Reviews.Title: “Roof Top Dining and Baroque Facade make for a unique experience!”
Reviews.Author: HPM1984
Reviews.Content: Located in the fashionable shopping (and expensive shopping I might add) district on Passeig de Gràcia, the hotel's Spanish Baroque exterior (apparently a former private villa) invites guests for a special experience. You will enter trhough 3 meter high modern glass doors into a marble floored small reception area- with a winding staircase heading up to the second and third floors to the right of the reception area. Reception and concierge were very helpful with our group- booking restaurants and ensuring all was okay. My Room was in the main building- comfortable duvet covered twin beds, that I suppose could be pushed together- but I never tried it. Internet connections were fine- and the shower area was standard and adequate. Full doors opened up onto a small balcony- which was great- if you don't mind the city noise (I like it but some people might not). However with the doors close the room was remarkably calm. Of course I always wear earplugs in a hotel so I might not be the best guide to this! Health Club was in the annex building across the street. Very small but with decent equipment. One of our party stayed there (in the annex building). It has none of the charm of the main building, and according to him it was very very noisy (he moved across to the main building and was satisfied). There is a roof top bar in the annex building - it has a really nice view of the avenue- with musicians playing the two nights we were up there for after dinner drinks. Breakfast is across the street from the main building- typical Euro buffet. Small downstairs bar in the main building is adequate but not much ambiance. Location is superb, service great, rooms comfortable, breakfast good enough. Don't stay in the Annex building - that is my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but undersatffed”
Reviews.Author: yjb53
Reviews.Content: Ideal location. Beautiful hotel with underground parking. Very clean. Good room service. Nice bar. But no free WIFI and hotel is badly understaffed. But overall, great value.

Reviews.Title: “the devil is in the details...”
Reviews.Author: fastiago
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! i can only think of a few things wrong with our stay, for one, breakfast was not worth the price paid and room service was a bit overpriced as well, but with such a wide variety of other places to eat in barcelona, it didn{t really mattter much. The standard room was small but then again the bed was huge! and the location... it can't get eny better!!!!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel in good position.”
Reviews.Author: rwh30960
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself travelled to Barcelona for the festive period and found the Hotel to be nicely located within decent walking distance to La Rambalas. on Arrival we were istantly asked if we would prefer a quieter room at the back of the hotel. in general the staff were friendly especially the very helpful Anna. the rooms were clean and tidy and in general a pleasant hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a poor value”
Reviews.Author: Megustaviajar007
Reviews.Content: It's a pity. I had stayed two years ago at this hotel, and returned because of its great location, in the Paseo the Gracia. But this time I found an uncomfortable room (small and a dowdy decoration) an equally uncomfortable bathroom (with old, frayed towels), all a poor value since the room cost more than $200. Also, the the service iwas very impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: dsmith2976
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday while she is studying abroad in Barcelona. Condes de Barcelona is only a few blocks from her school, so she stayed with me for the week I visited. While my daughter attended classes, I was in a perfect location to sight see, shop, and eat; thus, I was never bored. I also want to mention that Condes de Barcelona has a beautiful rooftop bar with a fantastic view of the city. The staff was exceptional and most helpful. I especially appreciated that everyone spoke English. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Condes de Barcelona --- great!”
Reviews.Author: Joannadee8
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised with the hotel. The rooms were comfortable, efficient and clean, the housekeeping staff friendly, the roof top bar had a fantastic view, especially at night, the reception staff, who spoke English, were all kind and helpful. The location on Passeig de Gracia was perfect. We could walk to everything....shops, restaurants, cafes, the tourist bus, Gaudi's apartment building. Only negative was the cost of using the hotel computer and printer. We would enthusiastically stay there again. A lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: nyc1111
Reviews.Content: Just want to echo the other reviewers that this hotel has excellent location - one block to Casa Mila and three blocks to Casa Batllo. We stayed at the new building - the rooms are clean but pretty basic, no memorable features. The hotel felt a bit crammed overall, and I wasn't able to figure out the underlying logic for the two elevators after two nights of stay (it appears that they stop when they feel like stopping). However, location-wise it cannot be better. The rooftop bar is cool and relaxed; the band was great on both nights. I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic getaway, but for everything else it's a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, breakfast and service”
Reviews.Author: trippinLa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 6 nights on a business trip and had the best time. My room was on the courtyard so no street noise. Staff was great and very helpful. Room was comfortable and large by European standards. I would stay again and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: MnJH5
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, rooms clean, large. Easy to walk to nearby resturants, shops, metro stations for outlying areas. Beautiful view of Gaudi's works, just a block each way from this hotel! Price was reasonable for the upscale location.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best, but great location...”
Reviews.Author: PharmaProud
Reviews.Content: The Condes de Barcelona is overall a disappointment. We did not pick the hotel ourselves as we were placed here for a meeting by our corporate travel management company. The hotel is adequate, but certainly not worthy of an 85% approval rating. I can only assume that these ratings are from people who do not do have to suffer from business travel as much as I do. The rooms are sparse and small, which is fine. The bed is ok, the pillows were nice feather, and the mattress was ok. What is not ok is the moldy bathroom, the lack of plugs for business travellers, unfriendly staff, a backwards Internet/TV system and lousy food. The workout room was so filthy and disgusting that I expect a breakout of flesh eating bacteria at any moment; it reaked of fungus and sweat. It had no cleaning products available (standard in most hotel gyms) so it is impossible to sanitize the equipment after using it or before. Gym is in sister property next door by the way. The floor of the sauna room, where I placed a towel down to avoid walking barefoot, was so dingy, that when I moved the towel afterwards, it was black with scum. I recommend staying outside and enjoying this fantastic city and drinking enough fabulous wine that you can collapse in your room when you return and overlook any deficiencies.

Reviews.Title: “location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: bulinatanya
Reviews.Content: At the beginning we like to stay at another hotel at Ramblas but it was full (lucky us) The Condes was perfect to us Grate location helpful staff and god value for $$

Reviews.Title: “A pitcher of sangria at the rooftop pool bar, with beautiful city view is not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: BGC03
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - rooms a little small but nicely decorated and great air conditioning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Food was excellent. Spa services (facial and pedi) were great. And after a hard day of sight seeing, there is nothing better than a pitcher of sangria and some snacks at the rooftop bar while surveying the cityscape and making dinner plans!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Reggie2u
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before embarking on a cruise. The hotel is in good shape. Very pleased with our room and the service. Great restaurant AROUND THE CORNER. On morning of departure we experienced some problems primarily due to language barriers. We were "check out" of our room before our departure, and were unable to use the telephone as a result. We were then directed to the "business center", which was closed. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: MartinHardee
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel experience with working Internet, to-die-for showers, comfortable modern decor, and other amenities. The rooftop bar has a great view but order just a few drinks and not tapas or you will be in for a surprise when the bill comes. A few oddities, like needing to call room service if you want ice. But on balance we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, felt quite luxurious...”
Reviews.Author: scousedovey
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, felt quite luxurious, our room looked out onto the main road and the "Casa Mila" fab view, very close to the Paseo de Gracia and Diagonal metro lines so don't get a cab from the airport just get a metro and city map and plan your trip! We didn't and the cab was 20 euros, the metro 10 trip pass was only 7 euros! The hotel is a good walk to the main night life however their is a lovely roof top pool and sun terrace and the sunsets are good from the bar as well, however next time we would book a hotel in the Gothic Quater or even a hostel as there is far too much to do and see in amazing Barcelona, can't wait to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Standard OK”
Reviews.Author: memberRossonWye
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - shops and attractions just steps away, tourist bus stops right nearby etc. We had a basic room - no view, just of inner courtyard. Room had everything you'd need (comfortable bed, air con, decent bathroom etc). Didnt eat breakfast at hotel (no need as loads of places along streets nearby). Restaurant would have been 140 Euros a head for a 3 course evening meal, so gave that a miss! European hotel that didnt provide coffee making facilities in room and no mineral water etc (mini bar was usual inflated prices), only BBC World News or CNN on TV, as for statellite you paid extra and so was wifi. Felt this was a bit mean for a 4star hotel, but maybe this is the same for other Barcelona joints. No help from front desk with cases on arrival and one of the main entrance doors was coned off (broken) for the entire week we were there - bad impression and just a bit sloppy for this grade of establishment. Felt this was a good quality hotel and we paid a fair price, but nothing that marked it out as special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: Chris5506
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at this hotel, on the whole our experience was average.Our room was small but it was comfortable, the downside was it looked out onto a light tower - no outside views and only air conditioning for air!!! Breakfast was a buffet style but very expensive for what it was. Reception staff were courteous and helpful, although we did experience surly waiting staff at the rooftop bar. The hotel reception was small with 2 lifts that were not always working. This hotel is in a great location with Gaudi's La Padrera and Casa Batllo in the same street - passeig de Gracia. The bus touristic stop just a couple of blocks away and some good restaurants nearby. Don't think we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: travel_diva_4126
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 1 toddler) stayed in this hotel for 3 days. We had a wonderful time. The hotel was centrally located, easily accessible from the airport (we took the train), and in the centre of some great walking areas. The hotel actually consists of two buildings across the street from each other. The room was average size, but nice and modern with dark hardwood floors, king bed and full bathroom. We had a 'family suite' which included a small corner off the main room where our toddler had her own cot. There was a complimentary mini bar as well. The staff were very friendly. We did not use the restaurant (the night we decided to go to the tapas bar, it was closed for a private function), nor other facilities so we can't comment on those. Overall, we liked the hotel, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bernsie01
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona for the final leg of our Spain vacation and were thoroughly impressed. The check-in was smooth and we shown to our room immediately. We had a wonderful view of the city from our bedroom. The room was modern, comfortable and elegant. The hotel is perfectly located near two metro lines and a block from the Casa Mila. We stayed five nights and were very satisfied. For inexpensive breakfasts walk a block north to a wonderful bakery located on the corner of Rambla de Catalunya and Carrer de Provence. It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “If your on a budget this is an okay hotel but I put in the extra money to upgrade”
Reviews.Author: honestopinion43
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the second part of our Spain vacation. The free breakfast is good for the fruit. This was a disappointment after staying at the Westin Palace Madrid. First we requested non-smoking because of asthma but they put us not only in a smoking room but smoking floor(they couldn't move us right away so had to stay in the room one night) The rooms are small with a modern style. The showers are only half shower doors and the floor would get all wet as well as anything you have on the bathroom counter after showering. We had two rooms and when we did get moved they put us by the service stairs and elevator which became loud with staff slamming doors and talking very loud this would start at 7:30a.m and end at around 10:30pm. The beds are quite firm. Pretty good location and great roof top view.(bar) We would have moved hotels on the first night but had paid in full through a package. All in all I would only stay here if your on a budget but if you can spend a little more money and upgrade do so.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could so much better.”
Reviews.Author: dennis045
Reviews.Content: On first sight, we had chosen well. O.K. - so we had booked through an agency, and had a basic room, but in a 4* hotel. We looked out onto a brick wall! It seemed to be clean and well appointed. We were aware that there were two restaurants - but to get to breakfast one had to cross a busy, four lane road, to the other section of the hotel - not too difficult on a warm, sunny morning, but I would not want to stay here in winter. The breakfast was fine - but I have had better. In the evening, the breakfast room becomes the restaurant, and the food was excellent, clearly influenced by the other restaurant (on the other side of the road, which holds a Michelan Star.) I am a foodie, and had intended to eat - at some price! - in that restaurant, but the basic restaurant was of such a standard that I could not justify the extra expense.
