So, what was wrong with the hotel? On the surface, it is well appointed and clean, but, behind the facade, this is an old building and all is not well. The hotwater system regularly deposits rust from old pipes in your bath! However, my main reservation about this hotel relates to the staff. For an hotel of 4*standard in the centre of the second largest city in Spain, I would have expected a better understanding of the English language from the staff - especially at the Reception level. Having reported that the room had been serviced, but no towels provided, it took over 4 hours and three telephone calls to deal with the matter. The following morning, the Management dealt with the matter in an appropriate manner - we were upgraded to a better room, but the staff member sent to assist us to move was, to put it bluntly, surly and rude. He provided no help what so ever. He was not alone in presenting an unfriendly response to enquiries, largely from lack of language skills. Many aspects of this hotel are fine, but being divided into two parts across a busy road is not helpful. I would say that there are many other hotels in this city, charging similar prices, that offer better value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel near Casa Mila”
Reviews.Author: MM_World_Travelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three days at this hotel, which contains super modern rooms with all the four star amenities. It was a refreshing break from the less modern hotels we stayed at in Madrid and Toledo. The bathroom is huge, and the bed is very comfortable. Our balcony didn't have much of a view, but we didn't mind as we spent most of the day sightseeing and just wanted a comfortable room to come back to. It is located only blocks away from the Metro and the train that takes you to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to be”
Reviews.Author: claytonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable and well located hotel. It is THE one to stay at. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and plenty of style”
Reviews.Author: unclepat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last week and it is perfectly located in the heart of the city on a very affluent shopping street. The hotel has an annex asross the street which is where we stayed. The fitness centre, pool, and roof top bar are very stylish and the rooms are nice if lacking any real wow factor. The restaurant Lasarte is absolutely superb. It is a 2 Michelin star restaurant so obviously not cheap but defienitely worth it for a special occasion. My only gripe was that some of the front desk staff were not the warmest but I would definitely stay here again as it is the perfect base to explore this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Simply lovely”
Reviews.Author: Nat25M
Reviews.Content: A lovely pillow menu...WOW..rooms excellent...location is very central and many many shops near the hotel, staff very helpful. A bit pricey but Lovely

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: catlover34
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Condes de Barcelona. It is ideally situated, the transport facilities were excellent- 3 mins walk from the railway station/metro. The staff were very friendly and helpful, our room was excellent, spacious and clean and large comfortable beds - a bit noisy as it overlooked the main road but we soon got use to this and it was worth it for the views. A visit to the trendy roof top bar/terrace and swimming pool is a must, just be aware the drinks may a little bit more expensive but again a worthwhile experience. There are plenty of bars/coffee shops to buy breakfast one, 5 mins from hotel called Fraggia? where you could get coffee and croissants for 2-3 euros The hop on hop off bus stops were close to the hotel and are an ideal way of getting around. We also enjoyed getting the lift to the top of the Sangrada Familia and the cable car by the Olympic Stadium which takes you to the castle (free admission)and has spectacular views over the city. We would definitely stay here again the next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff. Good value”
Reviews.Author: rjr2255
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room but not overly plush. Quiet at night, Across street from La Pedrera. One block to Metro. Easy walk to Ramblas. Overall a great value

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good, smart chic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Damien_and_Kate_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a 4 night break with my partner. Like other reviewers I cannot find much fault with the hotel, it is a high quality hotel and you get what you pay for - location, chic ambience and quality. My only slight complaint was the temperature control system in the room, plus the noisy corridor at around 7am with the service lift going up and down. Otherwise, I can wholeheartedly recommend it - the views from the terrace are amazing, the location is superb and is a great place to come back to after a day exploring the city!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel is a good location”
Reviews.Author: Addersiniho
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for 4 days on business and found it to be a very plesant hotel. I was upgraded to a slightly larger room with some nice added elements like Bvlgari toiletries, robe and slippers etc etc. The room was spacious with wooden floors and and nicely lit. The internal stone staircase is very attractive and has a slight Moorish feel. The location is excellent - in one of the better areas of Barcelona - surrounded by Chanel, Louis Vitton and Armani all nearby by. My only gripes where.... a) Breakfast for 20Euros was poor - there is an excellent small Tapas-like bar about a 60sec stroll away called Costa Gallega which did a lovely fresh Crossiant and coffee for just 2Euro! b) The sinks in the bathrooms release the water very slowly - giving a blocked appearance which is not very nice. c) No irons in the rooms Otherwise a very good hotel - ideal for a quick getaway Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot in town, very friendly service, very nice rooms... I will recommend to all my friends!”
Reviews.Author: BuRcHiN
Reviews.Content: The location is superb! The hotel is surrounded by very famous, yet delicious tapas restaurants, shopping opportunities, sightseeings... all in walking distance! Rooms are clean, beds are comfi, bathrooms are spacious! Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful! Terrace bar and the view is amazing! Breakfast is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keels71
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Condes for 4 nights this November and thought it was great,okay not the cheapest hotel, we paid €540 but fantasic location, 15 mins the Las Ramblas, 40 mins to the beach which we went to on the Saturday and Sunday, it was glorious!, on the Sunday the weather was 27 degress, sat in the beach bar drinking sangria, lovely!... We were just in a standard double but it was lovely and spacious, a lot bigger than I expected, could have done with a kettle but plently of cafe's to enjoy a coffee in. Great tapas close by Tapas 24 (think it was called) very Spanish and very nice,not just pieces of bread with something on top. This is our 2nd visit to Barcelona and won't be our last and will definatly be staying in the Condes again,drinks at the bar expensive but hey! .....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cb90
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, within 15mins walk of Las Ramblas, 20-30 min walk Cathedral and 5 min walk of metro stations. Good, clean room and service was welcoming and friendly. Breakfast selection was nothing to write home about but overall satisfactory. My only complaint about the hotel would be the level of noise....walls are paper thin and you could hear everything in the corridor and the room next door!! I feel sorry for those people in the rooms next door to the lifts!! If you're a light sleeper then dont expect much sleep!!! Overall good value for money and fantastic location, wld recommend to friends :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Shearart
Reviews.Content: Condes Barcelona was a very good experience. The location is right within walking distance to Paza Catalunya, Las Ramblas, both Gaudi Houses, and fantastic shopping and restaurants. The room was very well equipped, clean and modern. No iron or board in room, but when requested was instantly brought up. Breakfast buffett was full of wonderful fresh fruits, pasteries, meats, eggs, and expresso. The only down side was that the bed was very hard. I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel with excellent terrace.”
Reviews.Author: birddogilainen
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 day meeting at this hotel, stayed for 1 night. Nice hotel, excellent terrace (had lunch in the sun), good value for money, nothing to complain about really.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: bytepusher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a small group tour (14 people), the hotel itself was very nice and the location is unbeatable. Things were clean and the room was well equipped and not cramped. The staff was friendly but not always very knowledgeable and not always effective. For a business hotel the internet was expensive and the business corner a joke.

Reviews.Title: “nice city, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bakkra
Reviews.Content: Hello, we styed for four days in this nice hotel. Unfortunatly the room was not ready when we arrived, bute we got better room class (junior suite) instead of original room. thank you for that. the hotel is very good located, directly in middle of the bith famous GAUDI buidings and very closed to Plaza de la Catalunya and the Metro stations. In the paralell street we found very good Tapa restaurants and nice litle cafes for breakfast. Rooms a very well and service is very good. The roof terasse is amazing. Cause you have a very good overview over barcelona from there. But in October it was closed. This we really dislike, because temprature was wuite high in the evening. Also you can use on the roof a small swimming pool. I really dislike, that you have to pay for wireless lan. In this category I am used, that it is included in the price. We didn´t book breakfast, cause we like to see also the small very typical cafes. It was really nice to stay there. We wisch everybody a nice time in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great location lovely hotel good price”
Reviews.Author: wacca64
Reviews.Content: lobby very comfortable, staff helpful and location could not have been better for sightseeing especially the Gaudi sights and walking around barcelona we stayed inolder wing which we liked a lot but don't miss the roof top bar on the new building in nice weather its fantastic at night pools are only for dipping no real swimming because they are minute

Reviews.Title: “Reality Hurts”
Reviews.Author: snackwell
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite with two beds and ended up with a double room with one bed. Multiple "sorry" and limited effort to fix the issue - a free breakfast was thrown in. Shower leaked, modern lights were non-functional and rooms are loud. I say forget it...there is a huge selection of fantastic middle-class hotels in Barcelona. The great location of this one doesn't make up for the below average rooms, ammenities and service.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: paa9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Aug 25, 2009 the night before leaving on a 12 day Med. cruise. We arrived from Philadelphia, PA in the early morning and were very tired. Front desk had a room ready for us within 1/2 hour, which pleased us very much because we arrived way ahead of the check-in time. We stayed in the old part of the hotel and found it to be charming. Our room had comfortable beds, an excellent air conditioner, was very clean and quiet. There are plenty of restaurants nearby within walking distance. Safe area. We highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: rascotty
Reviews.Content: I went with my boyfriend in early sept to Barcelona for a long weekend and it was definitely the best city break i've ever had. The hotel was fantastic, the location could not be any more perfect as it was still close enough to the centre for it to be lively but far enough away that it felt wonderfully relaxing.....especially whilst sipping a drink on the awesome terrace with the sagrada familia as the back-drop (very romantic). Our room was in the older tower and we were lucky to have been given a corner room which definitely gave us a bit more room. It was overlooking the main road and yet i slept like a baby every night and the double sinked bathroom was beaut. Our room rate included breakfast which was good, infact we rarely ate lunch whilst we were there but if it hadn't been included we would have had no problem finding some place nearby. Although perhaps not suitable for breakfast the TORRES wine bar directly across the street we loved as very chilled out with great tapas and lovely wine. We had some fabulous meals and cocktails whilst we were there, El NOTI which was only a 10 min walk was particularly special as it was quite funky and the set menu was great value. We also asked at reception for a recommendation one evening when we were going to the Montjuic area and the place they sent us to was fab. It was called MONTJUIC EL XALET and had the most amazing view of any city i've ever seen. It is literally at the top of the montjuic funicular railway and we casually strolled up without a reservation and somehow managed to get an amazing table for 2 on the open air terrace...definitley worth booking and get there before sunset. All in all a fantastic trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “No need to look further, stay here. . .”
Reviews.Author: Mikey_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: This is a mid-size boutique hotel located in the Exemplar district. It's a 10 minute stroll down to the main Plaza outside of the old city and at the start of Las Ramblas, the pedestrian boulevard with its shops, street vendors and street acts. The Exemplar itself is a wonderful area to explore and has some of the best examples of Gaudi architecture a block from the front door of the hotel. We had rooms in the "original" building. (Apparently the hotel expanded at some time by purchasing a property across the street.) The hotel is clean, and quiet. The decor of the hotel in understated elegant. (If you prefer the decor of a Ritz Carlton, this hotel is not it.) The rooms we had were nice sized facing an interior couryard. What the room lacked in a view was more than made up for in a quiet stay--no exterior city noise to speak of. The rooms were nicely appointed--stone floors and counter-tops in the bathroom, wood floors in main area, heavy draiperies, high ceilings, comfortable linens and bedding, LCD TV. Great HAVC-quiet and efficient. The service at the front desk was veyr helpful for dinner reservations and other recommendations and they are licensed to exchange currency as well. The only negatives-- the two PCs used for web access are not free. The rooftop pool is small--but hey, we were not in Barcleona to sit around and swim laps. The mixed drinks at the rooftop bar are quite expensive at 12 EU. My recommendation is to enjoy the free salty snacks, order something soft and enjoy the view as the sun sets because it's absolutely spectacular. For most of us this hotel would be considered a gem. For special room rates, try paying for your stay, in advance and in-full with no refund available. Kind of like Priceline. . .

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, it's fab!”
Reviews.Author: sootycat31
Reviews.Content: My husband treated me to a weekend in Barcelona for my birthday. I stayed for three nights at the Condes with my sister, and we booked through Easyjet. Wow, what a fantastic hotel! I have to agree with the five star comments contributed by other visitors. When we arrived at the hotel we didn't realise it was on two sites on opposite sides of the road. We went into the the buidling that has a very old and glamerous lobby, and were told we would be staying in the buidling opposite. The building across the road has a really modern lobby, but the receptionist told us the rooms were the same. The room we were allocated was beautiful; lovely wooden floors, a georgeous bathroom and comfy beds. My sister and I are both non-smokers so had to ask for a non-smoking room. There are floors of rooms for smokers and floors for non-smokers. We didn't eat at the hotel as it was very expensive, however we saved 20 Euro each and had breakfast on the last day...well worth it. Getting to the hotel: We didn't do our homework and got a cab from the airport which cost a whopping 40 Euro. We then found out about the bus; this cost just 4 euro 75 cents each, took 23 minutes and dropped us of off outside the departure doors of the airport. Eating out: We got ripped off in a restaurant on La Ramblas on our first night. Next evening we discoverd a restaurant called Qu Qu on the paseo de Gracia. The food was good, prices and staff great and it was totally non-smoking too. Getting about: The Bus Turistic was great value. 27 Euro each for two days hop on hop off...9am to 8pm

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ana29
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 5-day stay in this hotel. The hotel is actually composed of two buildings each at one side of the street. We booked the hotel over easytobook.com and were first given a room in the part of the hotel in which the rooms have not been renovated. The room was OK, but I really disliked the bathroom, as it was visibly old, especially the bath-tub and the shower was fixed high on the wall and could not be removed and that is something I really hate. Furthermore, this room was overlooking the street. It had a wonderfull view onto La Pedrera, but it was however too noisy, especially in early morning because of traffic. So we decided to change the room after the 1st night and we were given a room in another part of the hotel and that one was completely renovated, everything was brand new, bathroom was aslo brend new, there was a tub with a normal shower. The new room was overlooking the garden, which was also a very nice view and it was soooo quiet. The hotel location is perfect - it is between two beatiful and famous Gauid's buidlings -La Pedrera and La Casa Batlo, both in the closest vicinity. The hotel is actually situated in a modern administration street, lined up with shops of famous brends. La Rambla and other sightseeings are at the walking distance. We used metro for some locations, there is a metro-station very close to the hotel and sometimes we used a taxi, which is not expensive. The lobby of the building with the renovated rooms has a charm of an antique building. You can see the stairs at my photos. There is a tiny swimming-pool at the roof, as well as a sun-bathing deck, which is also small and there are not to many chairs. But it is so convenient to refresh in the swimming-poll after sightseeing and then continue the tour of the city, as everything is so close. In the building with not-renovated rooms, there is a very nice roof bar. The staff is helpful, but could use some more kindness and helpfullness, but it is a problem all over the city. At least, they speak English quite well. There is wirelless and fixed Internet access, but nothing free of charge. We didn't try the restaurants, only the roof bar. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. It offers excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ImpressedofReigate
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel in the heart of the Gracia shopping area. Despite being on a busy road junction, the triple glazing meant little noise was heard at night. The rooftop bar was lovely at night with superb views over the city. Breakfast did not have the variety of other similar 4 star hotels but was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Shell1971SF
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the terrance rocks! The location was perfect..

Reviews.Title: “comfortable condes”
Reviews.Author: eime
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for designer shopping and sight seeing (gaudi buildings within walking distance). There is a fantastic view of sagrada familia from the terrace bar. We stayed in the beautiful modern side of the hotel with a large bedroom with outside seating area. The bathroom had no bath (minor grumble) and bvulgari toiletries (lovely). The outside pool is quite small although I presume that this is just for dipping in to cool off from the soaring heat in Barcelona. We ate in both reataurants loidl and lasarte. Loidl was nice, I had the veal which was lovely. They do the same kind of main course of veal (more expensive though) in lasarte which my spouse enjoyed. I had the sea bass which was lovely. Avoid apple pie in lasarte, a major disappointment, soggy pastry and too much apple. Enjoy their bread though at the beginning of the meal. The staff in reception were lovely, however we felt the restaurants could do with a major personality injection especially when one is spending a considerable amount of cash to eat in them! I must commend the housekeeping staff though, every day our room was immaculately cleaned. We ate in many beautiful restaurants during our stay. The one that stood head and shoulders above the rest was 'hisop'. Its not michelin star but certainly should be. Staff and food were fantastic. The suckling pig and john dory were incredible and very well priced compared to the well known michelin starred restaurants we ate in. Have the apple desert in ll'ucantes restaurant in barcelonetta area. It was divine, as were the sea bass and kobe beef . Avoid taller de tapas absolute rip off for what you get as is 'brown' restaurant, 6 euros for a tiny glass of orange juice?? Also hotel Omm. Beware they charge 1.50 euro servicio omm (not massive I admit, but its the principle). I enquired as to what this was and was informed it was for the use of the cutlery?? even after spending the bones of 40 euros on 2 cocktails and a dodgee sandwich!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooftop terrace called "Al Aire" in floor 7 open to non guests in the evening”
Reviews.Author: MarinaLussich
Reviews.Content: Even if you are not a guest at this Hotel you may go up for a drink or two at this marvelous rooftop terrace with views of la Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera and all the Paseo de Gracia rooftops.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, location not ideal”
Reviews.Author: wawa_maxmin
Reviews.Content: All in all, we liked staying at The Condes. It's a very comfortable and pleasant hotel. The hotel website makes it appear extremely posh, and it isn't. The two lobbies are small, and not at all impressive. The rooms (type "classic") are nice, but nothing more. We got our stay in an atrractive package deal, but had we paid full price for it, we would have found the facillities diappointing. Our room, located in the newer building, was spacious, odd-angled (which we liked), with a big bathrom. Of what we saw, most rooms aren't as spacious or as full of character as ours (no. 450), which was triangular and facing the cross-road. The triple glazed window made it very quiet. Unlike others here, we didn't find the location ideal. Maybe it is for businessmen, not for siteseeing. It is about 15 minute walk from P. Catalunia, the northern point of the actual centre. It may not seem like much, but in a place like Barcelona, where you constantly walk, we preferred saving our strength and using the metro. The metro station is located a few minutes down the road. That distance made us skip stopping at the the hotel in the middle of the day, though we were right at the nearest station changing lines. It is a hotel that makes you feel comfortable. We loved the attention for details: Quality soaps, thick towels, good matrress, nice sheets, messages sent over to your room. Also, the safe and minibar are a big plus. The staff was nice and helpful. It all makes you feel well taken-care of. The Hotel isn't as generous with his public facillities. There's a lovely roof-terasse, but having the hotel bar there makes it unpleasant to enjoy the view without spending. The pool, as many said, is tiny, And using the internet will cost you an astonishing 16 euros per day! Our deal included (a nice) buffet breakfast, but I would never have paid the asking price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: pickytrvler
Reviews.Content: We opted for a "Design" room, which was clean and spacious. Not enough closet room for a couple (5 hangers and 3 drawers? Come on.....) And I actually missed having a bathtub. After a hard day of walking the city, it would have been nice to soak my feet rather than take another shower. The room was very quiet, facing the back. We never heard people walking down the corridor or neighbors. The only thing we did hear was an occassional flushing from a neighbor's bathroom... Our card keys failed on us about four times during our five-day stay. But the staff were very pleasant and accommodating. The "pool" is strictly for show. If you're a serious swimmer, you can go around the corner and pay 25 euros to use a gym for the day. We didn't. The location of the hotel is excellent for the Gaudi buildings, shopping, and fine dining. Breakfast at 19 euros each is exaggerated; we went around the corner to a bakery and had freshly squeezed orange juice, pastry and coffee. I would have liked to have been closer to a metro stop (the avenues are quite a long haul) since we spent most of our time in the Born area. All in all it was very pleasant, very quiet, and comfortable (terrific bed).

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled”
Reviews.Author: LoulouStAlbans
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by the pool or tub on the roof terrace. Pool at max 3ft deep and cold and hot tub out of action for all our stay. Rooms compact but no tea/coffee facilities therefore maybe expecting you to pay 19 euros for continental breakfast. Service reasonable but if you are a frequent traveller maybe you don't need their help. Location ok but a long walk to old town which is certainly of more interest. Avoid roof terrace at all costs when you are thirsty small beer and vodka 14 euros. Although there are less interesting cafes which charge more. Always ask for price list first. £23.00 for a beer and sangria opposite hotel left me speechless. Barcelona is not for the faint hearted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Gerbouz
Reviews.Content: First time visiting Barcelona. This hotel was recommended by a friend. I must admit it was way beyond expectetions. Perfect location, very nice neighborhood, at walking distance from most of the "must see". Very suprised by the kindness of the staff. Very helpfull, very professional. Nice rooms, very clean and quiet (our room had a view on the backyard, not on the street). Reasonable price. I'm definitely going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ove the location”
Reviews.Author: Nikko001
Reviews.Content: great hotel - more expensive - but the location might be found priceless - really central and everything is in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel ,great location , just don't be tempted to order a drink”
Reviews.Author: Dean Calculator
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel , great location ,friendly staff and I would recommend the roof terrace bar with its views over the city ..... but just admire the views .......don't be tempted to have a nightcap of a couple of G&Ts unless you are prepared to part with €25 which at the time of writing is effectively £25 .... Leaving that aside it didnt affect our opinion of this terrific city or this good hotel , it can be a little noisy from the street below but the location is excellent and we would stay here again we would just have our nightcap at one of the many fantastic restaurants rather than at the hotel. p.s We would recommend "Taller de tapas" for an excellent lunch just toward the bottom of The Ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel on Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sptl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, very modern with a very sleek design. The rooms are very clean, with bvlgari toiletries, but also a little bit small. The bathrooms are very nice, very very clean and the have reasonable spaces. The hotel has two towers and a pool on each of them, great for relaxing after a fun night or a nice day of sightseeing. The hotel is located very well in paseig the gracia, barcelona most elegant avenue, just across the street form one of barelona's landmark, La Pedrera by Gaudi. I would recommend very much having dinner at Cerveceria Catalana, casual restaurant with delicious typical dishes from the region, 2 streets from the hotel, also at the Botafumeiro, that is a very elegant and therefore expensive restaurant. If you are looking to go out at night I would recommend very much the Sutton club, a short taxi ride from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodations, will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: immerseyourself
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel to stay at while on holiday in Barcelona that was in a nice, not overly touristy area that provided accessibility to other parts of the city with the Metro. The Condes de Barcelona fit this perfectly. Located in the Eixample, this hotel is close to some pretty good tapas restaurants and shops. The service was great, the rooms were very neat and provided a great view of the city from the rooftop, by the pool. I enjoyed the energy and the people in Barcelona, and when I visit the city again, I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but had roaches”
Reviews.Author: qcbear
Reviews.Content: There are many great things to say about this hotel. The location in wonderful, the rooms are modern and nice, the beds are very comfortable, and the staff was very helpful. Unfortunately, I saw 2 roaches on different nights in the bathroom which is why I would not return. The staff kept the place clean, but a hotel of this quality should insure that there are no infestations. I think for some people this wouldn't be a deterrent since they only come out at night and I only saw one small one at a time. It made me uncomfortable though, so keep this in mind if you are thinking about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tross9
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Barcelona - a weekend treat to celebrate our wedding anniversary - was delighted with the city and our choice of hotel. The location is fabulous, close enough to the subway to be able to reach most of the main tourist attractions within 15mins or less. We stayed in the Monument side of the hotel, the rooms were spacious, very clean and quiet even though overlooking the street below. The roof top bar (across the other side of the hotel) was a great place to start the evening with views across the city and La Pedrera. Found some great little bars within walking distance of the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful in resolving problems we had with the room key. Didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as a little on the expensive side but found a great cafe on the street opposite the hotel which was very reasonable. Would love to go back....just looking for an excuse to!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: HKO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in December 08 on our honeymoon and had a good experience. The location is great--we walked to most sites, and the subway is just a block away for everything else. We used the bar (good) and room service (tasty, prompt). The room was clean and well-appointed, except no hair conditioner or wash clothes, but we figured that was the European way. Quiet, nice, we got a great off-season rate of 100 Euros, so we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Am sure you can do better than the Condes in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinsuburbia
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again. While the location was excellent and the hotel was clean, we had some big problems that made it very uncomfortable. First, while I had been very clear in my email correspondence about needing one double and one triple room (for our three kids, ages 15, 14 and 12), we arrived and they did not have our rooms. They wanted to put an extra bed in a double room that only had one bed, but we insisted that we had been very clear in our reservation that we needed three beds. (In fact, in email correspondence, I was given the option of a having a triple room or having my two boys share a bed in a double room and I opted for the triple.) Finally, they squeezed an extra bed into a very small double room that had two beds. From my email correspondence, it was clear that this was not the type of room that they had intended to give us. That would have been OK, but it turned out that the extra bed was INCREDIBLY UNCOMFORTABLE. You could feel the springs everywhere. Plus, it was rather small, when my 15 year old try to switch beds with my 12 year old, so that my 12 year old could get some sleep, he could not fit. My 12 year old did not sleep much while we were at Condes (and you might imagine how much fun it was to be with him during the day). Some of the nights he slept in the crack between the two twin beds (which made me wonder how they could have even suggested that two kids share a bed in a double room), some of the nights he slept in my bed, and some nights, he tossed and turned on the cot. In addition, when we arranged to leave and tried to book a cab to the airport, the concierge told us to wait until later in the day. We needed a larger cab for 5 people (the standard ones only hold 4). We didn't insist that he just go ahead and book the cab (after all, what did we know... he was the concierge). As a result, we almost didn't get a cab as the p.m. concierge had trouble making the reservation. To boot, the fare was completely different from what the concierge had told us.... and I don't mean that it was lower than what we expected. In sum, the right hand does not know what the left hand is doing at the Condes. If everything goes smoothly, you may have a very nice stay. But the possibility of human error is much greater at Condes than at a better hotel. The concierge's excuse after each SNAFU was either that the reservations department didn't know what they were doing or that the other concierge could have been in training and, therefore, didn't know what he was doing. (By the way, the foot of my very "hip" bed had a piece of wood that almost caused me to break my neck on more than one occasion.) The Majestic Hotel is just down the block. I didn't stay there because they had booked all of their cots for our dates. It might be worth looking at. I considered the Hotel Arts, but decided that, since it was December, I didn't want to be that far away from the center of things. Amazingly, the prices there did not seem to be through the roof. I also considered the Hotel Colon, which is a good location (just across from the Cathedral), but had read that the rooms were a little tired. Of course, we were a little tired by the time we left the Condes.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerWirral
Reviews.Content: We had 5 days staying at this superbly located hotel. From our bedroom window we could see La Pedrera and from the roof terrace we had views of both la Pedrera and the Sagrada Familia (straight down a road opposite). Gaudi's Casa Batllo was a short block away - if you visit any of these make them first thing in the day to avoid long queues. The tour bus' stop almost outside and there is never a lack of taxis. The bedroom was blissfully quiet at night, comfy bed and pillows and the curtains had a black out lining. The roof top plunge pool and jacuzzi were refreshing after a hard days sighting seeing! Can't comment on the food as we ate out for both breakfast and dinner. We would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kasita
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, bellmen directed us to the underground complimentary parking, that was located conveniently in the under-grounds of the hotel. It took us about 20 minutes to check in....little long. Rooms were very nice and modern, some have probably some great views of the city. Bathroom is spacious and very comfortable, complete with Bulgari amenities, but be careful with the shower as it takes a second to figure out how to operate it during which you can flood the entire bathroom floor. There was a bar and a pool on the roof. Bar was great with some fantastic views of the city, including Gaudi's buildings. Pool....not so great. Very small, very, very small, but on top of that very dirty! I didn't even put my foot in. Breakfast buffet was nicely organized with several hot dishes and everything else you might enjoy in the morning, like scrambled eggs, smoked salmon and hot cappuccino. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant position, great facilities, good value”
Reviews.Author: harbottle
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Hotel, and we were not disappointed. Last time (two years ago) we stayed in the Centre building, this time in the Monument building. Of the two, although the reception and common parts of the Monument building are better, the larger rooms (and the direct access to the roof top bar and pool) make the Centre building a better choice. The position, just across the road from Gaudi's 'La Pedrera' (an absolute 'must' to visit), on the stylish Passeig de Garcia, could not be better. The staff are helpful, and the rooms of a high quality. There is a small roof terrace pool at the top of the Monument building, but no bar or room service. On the eighth floor of the Centre building (just across the road) there is a wonderful, very 'cool', roof top bar and a small pool. Breakfast is extra (and quite expensive), but there are numerous places within five minutes to sample the delights of Barcelona's cafe culture. This is a really stylish place to base yourself, with many of Barcelona's sights in walking distance, and close to a major hub in the Metro system

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Condes de Barcelona Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: clare_marktaylor
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here in August and the hotel was excellent. Perfectly placed for all the central sightseeing and shopping. A short walk from the Ramblas and quiet enough to get a good nights sleep. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly - one plus is the superb rooftop terrace & bar - a very pleasant way to start your evening in this superb city. The rooftop pool areas are very small, but providing you choose your time carefully, there are beds, free towels, a plunge pool and a jacuzzi. Breakfast was very good but try and get it included in your room rate - €36 for two is quite pricey, but well worth it. Service, a/c, cleanliness all superb and the rooms were spacious and very well appointed - We would go back and I would recommend this hotel to people wanting a superb base in the ritzy part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, impressive and a great location”
Reviews.Author: mann82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Condes 7th-10th April 2008 and I can honestly say I could not fault the hotel. I stayed in the new part of the hotel which was very modern, clean and contemporary. The room was fantastic- probably the largest bed I have slept in and a fantastic bathroom with a huge walk-in shower. The thing that I was most impressed with was the balcony- it was large and had the most sepctular view of the Passeig de Gracia and the Pederia. The location is excellent, in a very upmarket area, minutes away from some great modernista landmarks and the city tour bus stop. The staff were more than helpful and could not do enough. Very professional and welcoming. The only 'fault' that I could state was that there was a slight sewer smell in the corridor, particularly mid afternoon. In fairness I find that many mainland European hotels tend to suffer from this. I should add that the smell did not stray into the bedroom so it did not affect my stay too much. All in all I would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a special stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Bonnequin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by friends who spend their winters in Sitges. Our stay did not start out well. The hotel had changed around the rooms and were not going to give us what we booked, which was an executive room in the old building, with a view of the Passeig de Gracia. Luckily our friends spoke fluent spanish and argued with the front desk staff. We did end up with a smaller room, but it was at a reduced rate. Other than this incident, we were very satisfied. All the staff (except those at the front desk) were extremely friendly, the location was great, and the hotel clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but sullen front desk”
Reviews.Author: iancSurrrey
Reviews.Content: Set in a lovely preserved building on the corner of the main shopping street in Barcelona. Wife arrived first and was told by a stony faced character at the front desk no room was available. Typical arrogant staff you sometimes get, despite holding a confirmed booking. After she disabused him of this notion we were given a room overlooking calle de Mallorca on floor 1. (The hotel is split over two buildings the original old and the new face each other across this street) Room was fine, bed great, shower ok ish. What would make this a good choice in summer is the great roof terrace with sunbathing area bar and small pool. Also some excellent views from here. (Both annexes have them) Small bar downstairs was ok functional and for a 4 star reasonable. What makes it is the location. 2 doors down is a great tapas place Out the front door turn right. Lizaran go there say hi from me

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & smelly”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSlewSeattle
Reviews.Content: Spent a lot of money for a room in the Condes that 1) smelled like sulfur, 2) didn't have a trash can, 3) didn't have any amenities (roof terrace was closed), 4) required 45 minutes of waiting to get on the Internet, 5) required 2 hours to get a iron delivered, 6) gave me a single bed despite the fact I had reserved at least a queen and was paying for a 'premium room'.

Reviews.Title: “It could be so good at the Condes”
Reviews.Author: Donnietraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 6 years old daughter for our wedding anniversary break. We have been to Barcelona twice before and stayed near the FC Barcelona football ground (Hilton) and by the marina (Eurostars Gran) and we wanted to try a central location. We had checked out places previously close to the Passeig De Gracia and whilst I would have liked to stay at the Casa Fuster (too expensive) or the Majestic (a little too expensive and very variable room standards) we settled on the Condes (great location and 130 euros per night for all 3 of us and free breakfast for our daughter if we paid for ours at 16 euros). I had read the reviews on here and looked at the various photos on this site and felt that the rooms in the 'older' building would suit us better. We booked directly with the hotel and requested a room in the 'older' building which they noted. Upon arrival we were greeted in a polite but not over friendly manner by the reception staff. We were offered a choice of rooms and we were guided to them by a friendly porter to make our decision and not surprisingly we chose the largest of the 2 rooms given our daughter was sharing. I would say that the room size was above average with a very comfortable bed, large flat screen tv, a couple of armchairs, mini bar, safe and adequate storage. A fairly typical layout for hotel rooms I guess. Our room had a small balcony that looked over towards the Majestic hotel opposite and the triple glazing worked well in keeping noise levels down from the streets outside. It is fair to say however, that the rooms are in need of refurbishment and the bedding and towels have seen better days. The bathroom was nicely done out in marble but let down by mildew and mould stains, missing grouting and flaking paint. What is the point of Bulgari toiletries if there is mould on the ceiling and around the bath? The building itself is externally very attractive, in a superb location (one of the best in the city in my opinion) with wonderful views from the roof terrace which in the Summer should be a treat with a small plunge pool and bar area. We didn't use the bar in the hotel as it lacked atmosphere and given the location atmosphere is available aplenty elsewhere. Breakfast was across the road as others have described and decent enough (not as good as the Eurostars which was outstanding but better than the Hilton). Again there are plenty of alternatives given the location so try it once and go elsewhere if you are not satisfied. The staff were polite, and answered every query but did not go beyond this i.e no real interaction with guests and no one asked if we enjoyed our stay when we checked out. In summary the location is fantastic with every form of transport you are likely to need on your doorstep along with a superb selection of shops, bars and restaurants. The rate we paid was very reasonable for this location in Barcelona and we would struggle to find anything at that price on the Passeig De Gracia or close to it (I know I did try) . The refurbished new wing externally looks like the other building across the road but the management decided to give the rooms the minimalist treatment (the current vogue) and in my opinion missed the point of the asset they have which is a fantastic character property that demanded more characterful rooms to match. The rooms that have yet to have this treatment (i.e the building we were in) demonstrate that the refurb was clearly required and overdue but they should resist the temptation to take the minimalist route this time and keep the more traditional feel but with some new fittings, fresh grouting, a coat of paint and some new towels and bedding. Now if they could arrange a management training week to get the customer service up a notch or two and you have a first class hotel and that 130 euros rate becomes 200 euros and I cannot afford to stay! I do not want this review to sound too negative as we very much enjoyed our stay and I have to say many of the criticisms are in my experience common to many hotels worldwide not least the UK where I live. I have yet to stay in a hotel that has got everything right (subjective anyway) but I have stayed in many that think they have. I would challenge the management at the Condes to get their act together though and turn an ok hotel into a really good one with the best location in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: likesnicethiings
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between Christmas and New Year. Booked through the internet and chose this hotel purely on the tripadvisor reviews. Wish I hadn't. I could have got the 4 day break for £300 but paid £700 by choice as I thought I was getting a top-end luxury hotel. Big big mistake. To call the room minimalistic is an exaggeration. Stepping in from hotel corridor, greeted by slate grey floor and green glass wall leading into basic bathroom, housing the only mirror in the place- 2 foot deep- so all you could see was your head. Bedroom had laminated floor, cheap white cotton duvet, no mirrors, no decor to speak of, nothing, no luxuries whatsoever. Every noise echoed. I actually got told by my husband to stop making noise opening a bottle of water - it wasn't that I was making noise - it was just everything was ten times as loud because everything echoed. A huge off -white electric blind covered an entire wall of glass balcony door, which didn't lock. It was just like what I would imagine a prison cell to be like - the pure basics - nothing else! I know some people like contemporary style - but the only type I could see liking this hotel would be an ex-con who knew no different. Going home was like walking into Bucking Palace. To make matters worse we were almost opposite the Hotel Majestic - and having my husband say 'why aren't we staying there?' everytime we passed it didn't help. Do yourself a favour and give this a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lydia45
Reviews.Content: I would agree with all recent reviews. The location is excellent, in a very upmarket area, minutes away from some great Modernista landmarks. The Condes building (the original building) is pretty special in itself, with its restored staircase leading up to the rooms. Decor is generally a pleasant contemporary style though we found the furnishings in our suite a little bland. Our only true disappointment was the size of our junior suite for two adults and a child - it was really no more than a large double room with bathroom and spacious entrance/dressing area. Our child's bed had to be placed right next to our double bed. However some of the Ejecutiva rooms facing the very pleasant garden area at the back are equally spacious. Service at Reception was the usual sombre Spanish welcome but nevertheless completely professional and helpful when they needed to be. The buffet breakfast is superb, with fantastic selections of fresh fruit, cold meats etc. but guests visiting in winter should beware that it is served in the bistro in the new annex, and therefore requires venturing outdoors and crossing the street from the original building.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelbudfla
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the Passeig de Gracia - Our balcony had great people-watching and views, yet the room was quiet and dark at night - we slept very well. Contemporary decor. Bathrooms were nice and large. Room key is also used to activate all the lights/electricity. Service ranged from extremely helpful and friendly (bellman) to perfunctory (some of the front desk folks - others were helpful). We felt very safe - neighborhood is fairly upscale - (particularly high-end shopping) and central to great restaurants. Hotel is within walking distance to Sagrada Familia and Las Ramblas (both are fairly lengthy walks but very do-able - we're not in the best of shape and had no problem), and within a block of 2 subway stops and La Pedrera.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: GulfWanderer
Reviews.Content: We ended up here thanks to the inefficiency of splendia.com and the 987 Barcelona Hotel to give us the room we booked online originally. The Conde's location turned out to be even better than the 987 Barcelona's one with the two Gaudi buildings just around the corner and the next underground stop only one block up. We stayed in the older of the two buildings and our room was nice, bright and spacious. The bathroom, too, was a decent size with a good shower and nice toiletries. Reception staff were friendly enough and spoke okay English. We didn't book the room with breakfast, but there are plenty of little cafes and bars close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: gkaufman924
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews about the Hotel Condes de Barcelona prior to our trip, I was really nervous about what to expect when we got there. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very nice, the room was clean and well appointed, and the hotel was in a great location for walking around the city to see the sights. We stayed for 2 nights prior to leaving on a cruise and would have no issue recommending this hotel to a friend. We only ate the included breakfast each morning, so I cannot comment on any of the hotel's other restaurant/bar services. The breakfast was very good, although we never really did figure out how to order something cooked to order. It didn't matter to us though, since they had such a great selection of foods to choose from buffet-style.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not safe in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: damed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was recommended by a friend. Granted, it is in a great location. I just read the previous review (Oct 2007) and have to say I had encountered same problems. We stayed in the newer section and while the room was large by European standards, there was a horrible smell in the hallways. The hallways are stark and very univiting. I also had my wallet stolen while in the hotel so this is obviously a re-occuring situation. My partner and I were in the older bldg at the bar one night. A man came over and distracted us for a split second long enough for his accomplice to reach into my bag and snatched my wallet that included euros, driver's license, credit card, atm card and medical card. It took no longer than a second and when I told the bartender that my wallet was stolen, he offered us to not have to pay for our drinks. I felt right away that he was in on the scam. I immediately reported the theft to the front desk who was only somewhat sympathic. We found out later that this is not the first time it happened from another person on the staff. On our last day there, I asked a woman at the front desk to have some Traveler's Checks cashed (luckily I had some in the safe in our room). She was extremely rude to me even after I mentioned that this was the only cash I had left since I was robbed at their hotel. I have to agree that the staff is rude and you are not safe even if this is considered a higher end hotel. I would never visit Barcelona again. I had heard in Paris before we got to Barcelona that the city is filled with gypsies and petty thieves. Beware every minute while there!

Reviews.Title: “Luggage Safe Room. Not So Safe! Be Careful.”
Reviews.Author: smokey936
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona with excitement. We checkin with no problems. We were put in the new building across the street on the top floor with a great view of the Passeig de Gracia, wonderful. The room was clean except for a smell coming up from the sewer pipes, had to keep the bathroom door closed. My partner and I were to checkout on Aug. 25 to then go on a Cruise. That's when the trouble started, upon our checkout we had 3 hours to shop, so we had to put our luggage in there "Safe Room" We retuned with our luggage moved from were it was and to your horror we realized that someone went into one of the bags and stole a Wallet that contained a Pass Port, Credit Cards and $100.00. We could not board the ship with out a pass port and had to go back to the Condes to figure out what to do next. Filled a Police report and had to wait till Monday to get a new Pass Port at the American Consulate. The Hotel Management denied that the thief was in there hotel, but we know otherwise. And on top of that the Hotel still charged us for the additional 2 nights that were had to stay before taking a flight to Ibeza to catch up with the Cruise Ship. The rest of our vacation was awsome.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service here”
Reviews.Author: chompere
Reviews.Content: Great location, but as others noted, bad customer service. Also, the hotel has 3 or 4 tiers of rooms and the price varies by tier, and by day of the week. It's a bit hard to understand the pricing, and front desk staff were impatient when asked to clarify. We looked at 4 rooms and they varied tremendously in style, light, and roominess. Several were great, others just OK. You may want to see your assigned room before committing to it. Roof decks were nice, but the terrace in the old buidling was closed the 2 nights we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bed and breakfast - but that's about the only nice thing!!!”
Reviews.Author: GemL_K
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via easyjet and were not informed of the rennovation works by either easyjet or through looking at the hotel's own web site. We arrived at 12 noon but were unable to check in, even though a man arriving 15 mins after us was allowed to. We were put in the modern side of the hotel, which we later found out wasn't a good thing! We arrived back at 8:30pm after a long day of sight seeing and were given a room where the TV was broken. We contacted reception who told us there was nothing that could be done until the next day and after a drawn out 45 mins begrudgingly gave us a room next door. The room was ok and a good size, the bed very comfy. However the shower leaked every time you used it and required 4 bath towels to mop up the floor, the sinks sprayed water everywhere, the lighting in the room was terrible and you couldn't open any windows. There was a huge blind which once was up allowed everyone to see in from opposite buildings. The room was clean though the workmanship from the rennovations was poor and shoddy quality. The location is great - very central to most areas. I agree with the previous reports, the majority of the reception staff could really seem to care less about guests. Requests for assistance were provided, but grudgingly. There is no concierge service. They refused to call taxis for us and when we asked them to book one for our return trip to the airport we actually saw them flag one down for us (i.e. they never pre-booked it). They gave us no information about the hotel upon check-in (i.e., location of the restaurant, hours of dining, hours of the piano bar, pool bar, etc) and we didn't even know there was a lounge/bar area until we walked to the other building to look for ourselves. This is not a four star hotel on the newly rennovated side and there are definitely nicer places to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Condes”
Reviews.Author: 2moons02
Reviews.Content: We were incredibly pleased with the Condes. You can not beat the location. It is like staying on 5th Avenue in NY. Everything is close by or easy access via the metro. Two Gaudi buildings are within 2 blocks. The architecture in the area is beautiful. Most important we felt incredibly safe. Room was very modern although a little small compared to American hotels, but VERY comfortable. Beautiful modern marble bathroom with Hermes toiletries. Renovations were underway on the lobby, but it was still very peaceful. YOU CAN NOT GO WRONG HERE.

Reviews.Title: “How do you say "unhelpful" & "unfriendly" in Spanish?”
Reviews.Author: Travelfor2GA
Reviews.Content: It appears we were staying in the hotel around the same time as the most recent 2 reviews in early September & agree with them completely. We booked a Condal room directly on the hotel's website for 4 nights. Let's start with the positives....the room was fine - the doors opening out on to the main street are soundproofed, which was great for noise control. The room was relatively clean, although the shower could use some help in the mildew-removal department. The location is great - very central to most areas. Now the negatives - the staff could really seem to care less that you are there as a guest. Requests for assistance were provided, but grudgingly. There is no concierge service. The hotel did not bother to mention that they are doing renovation and construction in the hotel online when booking (as most reputable hotels will do). The hotel staff provides you no information on the hotel upon check-in (i.e., location of the restaurant, hours of dining, hours of the piano bar, pool bar, etc). The pool is very tiny and the outdoor hot tub water was green. The posted hours for the piano bar & pool deck bar were never actually accurate - one night open, the next night - not open. The piano bar off the lobby of the hotel was open one time of the 4 days we were there. This hotel has some great amenities, but no one seems to want to tell you about them & even if they did - chances are, it would not be open or operational if you did manage to stumble upon them. We strongly recommend finding another place to stay. This is not a four-star hotel & definitely not worth the cost or the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel! over priced, unattentive staff, lousy customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ms_charming01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel from August29- September 4, 2007. The hotel is housed in an old mansion which located in a good location on Passige de Gracia next to Gaudi's buildings. The room was newly remodeled with beautiful furniture and nice bedding. However, this hotel has no intention to provide any service to it's customer. The front desk staff are very unskilled and unaware of the attending the customer needs. No concierge services! In several occasion that I have asked for direction to different locations from the staff, they have given me totally wrong address that has caused me to get lost in town. The hotel does not provide movie and international channels. I have to call several times and 2 days until they programmed my TV to access CNN, no other international channel was provided. The internet service from the room was not working and they charge 2 Euros for 10 minute internet access while I was charge 1 Euro for 1 hour of internet use in an outside internet café. Hotel’s main restaurant was closed and there was no food served at the bar on roof top. Pool is actually a very big tub with whirlpools that do not work. The health club very primitive and most weight training equipment were broken. I was allowed to park in the parking one night and the other night the same person who admitted me to the parking garage told me I could not park there since it is under construction while they actually tried to charge me for 2 nights parking! The only front desk person who was polite and provided service was a nice girl called Clara who patiently found me a good deal on a rental car and made me reservation; her recommendation for a hair salon was perfect and her addresses were accurate to the point! I am grateful that she was working there to help me out when I was so frustrated wit the hotel staff. The hotel is over rated and expensive for what it is; I will not go back there again and do not recommend it to anyone who pays for a 4 star hotel and wants to enjoy the services that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: “Plush hotel - work in progress-”
Reviews.Author: travelbug093
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our last night in Spain and we stayed in the property across the street. Evidently, both properties have construction going on...the main property was super loud in the lobby when we checked in and the guy said, "don't worry, you are staying across the street". That property was a bit more modern in decor and there was construction going on there as well. Right outside our door in the elevator shaft. Luckily it stopped at 6 or 7pm and we had to be up at 7am to leave but I can imagine that others on our floor would be upset and after seeing other recent reviews, I think it's a problem. The room itself was sleek and modern but oh so cold. The thermostat was set to 20/21 but it felt like an freezer in there. Luckily they had a down comforter in the closet. The bathroom is really cool but the design of the shower is stupid. Water just flows out onto the bathroom floor and beyond. The location is great although you are in the middle of the shopping/tourist areas but if you want to stroll down and visit a couple of Gaudi's famous works, they are right there. It is also close by a metro stop. You gotta go through a construction zone to get to breakfast and like another reviewer said, it's set up to feel like a business-travel hotel but the food was good and a great selection of fruits/fruit salads. I'm sure both properties will be ultra cool/lovely once they are finished with all of the work.

Reviews.Title: “hit the jackpot with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessieDublin
Reviews.Content: Moved in from the Plaza dEspanya to the Condes de Barcelona and thoroughly enjoyed our three day stay there. There were teething problems; the reception staff are pretty inefficient and mucked up the booking, and we accepted the third room they offered, but we still loved the place. The central atrium in the foyer is impressive and the view from the rooftop terrace over the Passeig de Gracia and over to the La Pedrera rooftop was just breathtaking! The pool was tiny but fine for popping in toes! The room was lovely, well sound proofed considering its location overlooking a very busy street.(The Passeig de Gracia is the best shopping street ever!) The bathtowels were the thickest and fluffiest I have ever seen. We had robes, slippers and Bvlgari toiletries. Didnt go for the overpriced breakfast but there is a Jamaican cafe around the corner where we had coffee and a danish for a song. The hotel has two buildings, the second is still a work in progress but we saw one of the rooms and it looked very nice. Bit too much of a building site yet tho.. We only had two gripes; the cushions on the (six) terrace sun beds were inexcusably filthy (the hotel did supply large towels for bathing) and there is no pricelist for the rooftop bar; we paid 13euro for two regular coffees and a bottle of water, nearly fell off the roof in shock!! The staff, while inefficient were very friendly. All in all a great hotel with a great vibe and in the most amazing location for e129 plus 7% Vat for a standard double per night. We're just back and already making plans to return.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: Helena101
Reviews.Content: My first shock came upon arriving at the hotel: we were sent to the building across the street!! My family and I had specifically looked for a hotel of architecture "modernista", which the main building of Comptes de Barcelona is certainly a good example of. Neither from the web page nor from the travel agent, I learnt that most of t he rooms of the hotel are located in a building across the street. I felt tricked. I should say, though, that the rooms are nice and very comfortable. I also felt disappointed by the hotel staff. When I thought that many of them were not very friendly, I observed how catalan speakers were treated in three different occasions: they were practically humiliated for speaking their own language. Overall, although the hotel is comfortable, my family and I left with a very sour taste.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: snobig
Reviews.Content: Really impressed with the hotel. Very clean, modern and equiped with every thing you need. Very central to all you want to visit. Staff very helpful and friendly. Not far from the beautiful long golden sandy beaches. Shopping a must. we would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a lovely relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Lovely building, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: kittyhola
Reviews.Content: I picked this location for an overnight stay in Barcelona with my two young daughters. Primarily I chose it because I like the Passeig de Gracia area better than Las Ramblas particularly when travelling with children. The location was excellent for us - straight out onto the "nice" shops, plenty of eatiries and very close to two of Gaudi's famous buildings. The room was very nice - I requested one in the old building having read other Tripadvisor reports. They put in an extra bed for us and that worked fine. The rooftop terrace is very nice for a scenic drink but the pool is miniscule. More of a tub or footspa! Breakfast was in the newer building across the road and was expensive but then I think hotel breakfasts always are. A pleasant and easy stay which is what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Gaudi-tastic”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy2Cool4Skool
Reviews.Content: Fantasic location on one of the main shopping streets. The hotel is located on a corner of a junction, on the opposite corner of the junction is one of Gaudi's most famous buildings which houses the Gaudi Museum. This provided a breath taking view each morning when opening he curtains. There were good transport links with a bus stop outside the hotel. Very nice rooms and bathroonms made for a great weekend in Catalonia

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location, but....”
Reviews.Author: JoJo_westy
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 nights through lastminute.com - can't remember how much but hardly cost anything considering the price included BA flights from a real airport! Anyway, this hotel is great! Apparently it's in two buildings which is confusing when you check in, but the part we were in was very well done. Didn't use the facilities (not my thing, I prefer to go out of the hotel for anything other than sleep) - but the room was fantastic with a balcony (no view but a coffee table, sofa and was still a decent size balcony so nice place for a drink), amazingly comfortable beds (2 doubles) and very similar to the Sheraton Sweet Sleepers in comfort! Very contemporary, well fitted and equipped APART FROM - and I'm sure this was probably just something in my room but the cleaners should have picked up on it -------- The shower cubicle was big enough for a party, so was the bathroom overall, BUT - the bloody shower door didn't seal with the stone floor, SO --- after even a very very quick shower, you ended up with a small pond on the bathroom floor and found it seeping its way out into the room..... It was used after we checked in before we went out, so we just ignored it and tried not to walk in the bathroom after, but when we used it again in the morning and the floor looked even worse after, we just said sod it and went out to party, however I found it very strange that the cleaners didn't pick up on this as we came back to a fully made room with fresh towels, but soaking wet pond like bathroom! Overall - great hotel, stay there, you'll love it - just make sure your bathroom (which is gorgeous!) doesn't leak! I was there for 24 hours and a little drunk, so it wasn't the end of the world (especially at the price I paid!), but I am used to high end hotels around the world and wouldn't expect such a problem to ever happen, let alone go un-noticed.....

Reviews.Title: “Super clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: EastbourneGussie
Reviews.Content: Super hotel in a great location. Couldn't have been more comfortable. The room was very clean with a super big bed which was very comfortable and had lovely sheets and pillows. The balcony overlooked the Passeig de Gracia but was very quiet because of the double doors and blackout curtains.The bathroom was very clean with a great shower room and even had a telephone by the loo?? The staff were a big brusque but helpful if treated right. Would stay there again without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GillianandJames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condes for 3 nights in April. The hotel has a great location for sightseeing and shopping. We stayed in the newer side of the hotel and the room was huge with a great bathroom. The staff were adequate not over friendly but you tend to get that in Barcelona. All in all a great stay, very comfortable hotel with a mero stop just a skip away aswell as the fantastic gaudi buildings. I would go back and stay here again and have recommended to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazza78
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was in the older side of the hotel. Decorated beautifully & had a little balcony. Really comfy bed - so we slept in a lot longer than we should have on our last day. The location of the hotel is perfect. Really close to Casa Batllo & La Pedrera. We walked to La Rambla & Sagrada Familia no problem. One walk along La Rambla made me very glad we were not staying around there. Always felt really safe walking around at night too. You should get the train to & from the airport...as it stops on the Passeig de Gracia. Only a 2 min stroll to the hotel. We paid 26 euros for a taxi from the airport ...because we didn't know the airport train stopped at that stop. It was actually faster getting the train back than getting a taxi & it cost 2.50 euros. The taxi queue is really long when you come out of the airport. The metro line on Passeig de Gracia can take you direct to Nou Camp or Parc Guell. Any decent guide book or website on will tell you how to get from the metro stop. A lot of people recommended the Tourist Buses. They cost 19 euros and a journey on the metro is 1.25. Bit of a difference. It is the easiest Metro system I have ever been on as well. Although it is a bit of a walk to Parc Guell from the metro stop. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel and there are lots of really nice little cafes nearby. Our shower wouldn't turn off properly and the person at reception had someone up to fix it within 10 mins. The reception staff also requested the maid was sent up to clean the bathroom again. The reception desk was always really busy so when you check in ask about where to eat. We didn't and never really found anywhere for dinner or lunch that I would recommend. The staff were nice enough - definitely would not describe them as rude. The only disappointment was there was no one serving drinks on the roof terrace

Reviews.Title: “Very lazy and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tjp1994
Reviews.Content: The quality of the hotel is good, but all the staff should be fired. The rooms are fairly small but decent with a good bathroom and we had a room at the back of the hotel looking over a courtyard with a nice balcony. There were works going on in the other part of the hotel on the other side of the street. Colleagues of mine have been complaining about noise. Fortunately I heard nothing as I was at the back of the hotel. The breakfast was hard to find in some back part across the street. it was without any charm or luxury. Hotel has a nice top roof terrace and small (yes: small) outside pool. The terrace would have been nice if there was anyone serving drinks or anything. General feeling was that staff was very unfriendly and uninterested. You have to ask everything twice or three times, and they prefer to be lazy. Thy twice refused to call a hotel for me and just gave me the phone. Another time I asked for extra shower gell and they said you can collect it in some room in the basement. Lazy lazy and unfriendly staff, but the hotel does have a great location and building.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Condes in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LondonSATraveller
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a five night stay at the Condes de Barcelona and can't recommend it highly enough. We were lucky enough to be staying in the older building and were upgraded on arrival. The room was spacious, clean and beautifully designed. We were on the main road which was a bit noisy first thing in the morning but this didn't bother us too much. We thought the location was perfect, within walking distance to most of the main attractions and very close to two Metro stations. We didn't eat at the hotel but they have a new restaurant which has had great reviews so could be worth a try. If we visit Barcelona again we would definitely stay here,

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel in a classic building”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Voyageur
Reviews.Content: I love the way European designers can take a classic old building, give it a sleek, modern interior, and make the whole thing work. That has happened at the Condes de Barcelona. (The hotel occupies two buildings, one on either side of Carrer Mallorca. We stayed in the one on the westerly side and did not see anything of the other building.) Our "condal" double was decently large, with a small balcony looking over the busy Passeig de Gracia, the main boulevard of Barcelona's fashionable Eixample district. With two layers of French doors, each with insurated glass, the room was silent, despite the busy streets. Our friends were less impressed with their conventional double, which was not as large as our premium room. The location could not be better. The Eixample district combines New York's Fifth, Madison, and Park avenues into a mix of residential, commercial, and retail uses that is endlessly fun to walk through. With buses and metro handy, there is easy access to the entire city. For those with comfortable shoes and the inclination, all major sights are within walking distance. For those with uncomfortable shoes, Gaudi's La Pedrera and Casa Batlló are within two blocks. (In the Catalan language, Batlló is pronounced Baht-YO and the famous Parc Guell is pronounced GWAY.) There were several business meetings in progress while we were at the hotel, but the layout made their presence unobtrusive to us vacationers. The amiable bartender produced excellent martinis, at predictably high prices (€8.50). We avoided the €16 breakfast by finding cafés and shops in the neighborhood, where all four of us had café con leche and croissantes for that same €16 or less.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building”
Reviews.Author: MARIA5
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel and I would definitely stay here again . The linen /towels were of excellent quality, this may sound a strange comment but when you have stayed in as many hotels as I have , beleive me it makes a difference. The rooms are not overly big but beautifully furnished and at the end of the day it would be a crime to start tampering with the wonderful design. Front desk /bar staff could do with a bit of a reminder they are in the service industry, but found the doormen very helpful/ courteous. We did not use public transport only taxis which although just outside, they always went and got. Thought the location to be excellent, had previously been warned to be very careful about crime in Barcelona but as location is so central didnot feel at all threatened. My favourite bits of this hotel were the beautiful staircase and my lovely little balcony. As we were at the back of the hotel we had no problems with noise. Cant comment on the pool as was not even aware they had one! We were just given our keys by the front desk and no other hotel information volunteered. Breakfast was not included in our package so I cant comment on food either. Got to say though I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and hope to be returning later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel/Annoying Staff with Attitude”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTravelers4
Reviews.Content: We booked our room by dealing directly with the hotel. Emails were prompt and courteous. What we were not told was that this hotel has two buildings--the lovely original building featured in the website and the newer facility across the street, which is not the least bit charming or appealing and the rooms are much smaller. When the three of us arrived--my husband and I were traveling with our teenage daugther--the bellman began taking us across the street, based on the instructions of the woman working at reception who did not even speak to us. Upon seeing what was basically a closet for three people, we insisted on seeing what was available in the older building. We were taken to a lovely room that was not huge but certainly spacious enough for the three of us, with a classy marble bathroom that had plenty of room and two showers. We were told that they had been trying to do us a favor by cramming us into the afore mentioned closet as they would be working on the elevator in the old building during our stay and did not want to inconvenience us. We took the larger room and what do you know? There was nothing at all wrong with the elevator and they for some reason had made up a ridiculous story to attempt to stick us in the inferior accomodation. Perhaps it is because we had booked early and had a great rate...Who knows. But it was the height of rudeness and disrespect.
