The staff remained consistently aloof and though they did in fact speak some English, they certainly did not go out of their way to be helpful at any time. We are very independent when we travel and do most of our sightseeing on our own or through tours that we book privately....so their indifference didn't matter to us, but if you are coming here and thinking the concierge will be of assistance, you will be disappointed. Otherwise, the hotel is clean and comfortable with a great breakfast and reasonable rates for Barcelona. The location may be a plus or a minus depending on how you look at it. It is situated on what you might call Barcelona's upper east side...about a ten minute walk from Las Ramblas and the old city. We loved the location as it was close enough the the craziness, but far enough away to escape the carnival atmosphere if you wanted to. Great restaurants within walking distance and a half a block from Casa Battlo, the amazing home designed by Gaudi for a private client. So many travel agents put clients at the waterfront. It is a long hike into the center of town from there and unless you are planning to actually sit on the beach, it's really out in left field. Certainly worth a visit for lunch and a stroll. Our favorite restaurant was Casa Calvet, another Gaudi building turned into a restaurant. Exquisite surroundings and food to match. Even our 18 year old swooned. Stay at the Condes for lovely accomodations at really reasonable rates, great shopping and access to all the sights...Just be sure to insist on the old building and don't expect anybody that works there to give you the time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: babsdc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Spain. One of our favorite hotels was Condes de Barcelona. The location was fantastic! Beautiful, safe, yet close to the action. The hotel completely met our expectations. We had a smaller room, and I didn't find it crowded at all for two people. Only thing to be careful was booking on line. We didn't get a confirmation so we ended up booking twice. Be patient! I would highly recommend this hotel. I am so glad that we didn't stay any closer to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay - Very Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: danni&dave
Reviews.Content: I have to say what a wonderful stay my husband and i had at this hotel. We were originally told to check in after 2pm however as we had an early morning fllight we arrived just after 1130am and the staff were more than happy to take our suitcases to our rooms. The rooms were very pleasent and i wish i could have taken the pillows home as they were the best i have ever slept on. We had a room facing the side street, the double glazing kept out all of the noise from the streets. As it was my husbands birthday i pre ordered a bottle of very nice Cava and was lead to belive we had to pay for it at the end of our stay - but to my surprise they gave it to us for FREE!! The breakfast room was in one of the hotels very good restaurants accross the road it was very basic but kept us going until the afternoon. Our return flight was a late evening one and the hotel was very helpfull in storing our cases after we checked out and even arranged for a taxi to pick us up - We found this hotel to be of a very high standard and i would love to go back there again!! A word of warning - we found the majority of restaurants along the Ramblas with the seating outside can be quite expensive expecially for the LARGE beer glasses (anything up to 12 euros each) but do look out for the Paella and sangria deals roughly 9 euros each. A trip to the Nou Camp is a must, you can get on the underground at Diagonal and a one way journey is 1.25€ per person, its roughly about 12 stops but well worth a trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Unwelcoming Staff - Downright unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: simonjacob
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are lovely, the staff is very unfriendly and discourteous. We are very easygoing people. and experienced travellers. However, the staff was very unwilling to answer basic questions regariding airport transportatiion and restaurant recommendations. One women behind the desk just seemed to be angry all the time. While I love Barcelona- this hotel experience was very distrubing to me. Definitely not a service oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Service With A Smile...Skip TRhis Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGuide
Reviews.Content: Like many of the reviews say, this hotel has a wonderful location in the heart of Barcelona right on the Passeig de Gracia and near the many Gaudi attractions and high-end shops. The rooms are small and a bit drab; yet, this could still be a good choice, except for the TERRIBLE SERVICE. Service at this hotel is totally lacking! Before we traveled, I tried on numerous occasions to enlist the help of the conceirge to make advance dinner reservations for the nights that we were meeting business friends. Well, there does not seem to be a concierge, leaving such tasks to the front desk personnel. I tried emailing the hotel directly from its Web site, but received no response. Eventually, I tried faxing the hotel, and finally received a response by email. However, my replies back usually went unanswered. Upon arriving at the hotel and throughout our 5 night stay, it just didn't seem possible to get a smile or a positive reaction from anyone at the front desk. Inquiries were curt and matter of fact, at best. Calls to the front desk from our room often went unanswered. Twice I needed to go downstairs to the front desk, only to find one of the two clerks tying up the phone line with a personal call that she chose not to end until I interrupted her. Further, our room was never cleaned before 3:30 PM and in two days of bsuiness meetings in the hotel, the meeting rooms were never cleaned during breaks nor were water and sodas replenished. I have travelled to many fine hotels, and I'm sorry to say that this just isn't close to that class. For whatever reason (perhaps is training), they just don't seem to care at all. It's too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Condes”
Reviews.Author: cerrazquin
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Barcelona just before New Year. The Condes was excellent. We found the Hotel through Trip Advisor and the hotel met all our expectations. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Our 13 year old son stayed in the room with us comfortably. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. They gave us great restaurant recommendations. Our room had a great view of the Goudy house. The area around the hotel is upscale with great designer shops within walking distance. We would go back to this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Dont plan to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: cyntia
Reviews.Content: The Condes is near most of the major Gaudi buildings, great shopping and restaurants, and a short walk to Ramblas and the Barrio Gotico. Clean and bright, our room had a great bed and a huge bathroom with one of the best showers I've ever used. The staff was not particularly helpful, but we didn't need much from them anyway. The room faced a side street, noisy with street life at night and then in the morning work crews arrive to start in on the numerous construction projects nearby, so dont plan to sleep late. Maybe the rooms that face the courtyard are quieter. We never ate at the hotel, as there were so many great and inexpensive dining options nearby. Viva el menu del dia: you can eat better and cheaper in this city (and in with Madrid) than anywhere else in Europe. Other than the noise, we had no complaints. Barcelona is a magical city and you won't want to waste your time sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: praktikalmagic
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a great location, very helpful, friendly staff. We had 3 rooms - all were well decorated and in a great part of the city. Perfect for the main shopping and tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Bueno! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ryssee
Reviews.Content: Super comfortable big beds, nice marble bathroom, quiet especially for the location. Great service. Great location in upscale shopping area, close to transportation and 2 famous Gaudi houses, and a 10-minute walk to Plaza Cataluna. One or two blocks from Les Rambles. Nice wood decor. We loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: BunnyGirl1957
Reviews.Content: We spent a long time looking for a hotel in Barcelona that would have rooms large enough to accommodate our family of four. We were absolutely thrilled with this hotel. We had two rooms which were adjacent, not adjoining, but they were the only rooms down a small hallway which could be shut off from the main hallway. Consequently, when we shut the hallway door, we could leave the doors to our individual rooms open and we had, in effect, a suite. The rooms, although small, were spotlessly clean. Our windows overlooked the main street but we heard no noise. The bathrooms were large and immaculate. The front desk was easy to deal with. Location is excellent. We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Condes de Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: carmenne
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Condes de Barcelona. It is convenient to Las Ramblas and all the Barcelona sites, on a good street, nice view from the rooftop (albeit a tiny "pool"). Staff were very helpful, very clean room. No problems whatsoever. I have recommended the hotel to three people who have stayed there and come back agreeing it was in a great location and well priced. Found the room price cheapest via their own website.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: house5
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is located on one of the primo streets in Barcelona, not far from Las Ramblas. The hotel bills itself as a 4 star and I would admit it deserves it. The rooms are a little small but clean with a excellent bathroom. The AC worked well even in hottest days in August. The staff is friendly and courteous. For example as our cab pulled up a bellboy was waiting with a list of guests to arrive that day and confirmed our stay and greeted us.The only downside is that the pool is tiny! We initially thought it was a large jacuzzi until we confirmed otherwise. However given the fact that most hotels in this part of town are in 19th century buildings any pool at all was a plus even if small.If you are with someone who loves shopping the hotel sits on one of the high end shopping streets in Barcelona and is 2 blocks from one of Gaudi's architectual masterpieces as well as being close to the metro. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_O'Reilly_Family
Reviews.Content: After some searching on Trip Advisor, we decided to book Condes De Barcelona for our five day stay there. We were not disappointed. The location is fantastic. almost exactly ten minutes from the ramblas, so it's near enough to walk, but not close enough so that it's dangerous. There was a great buzz in this area, without it being too loud or crowded. Approx. three minutes walk from two different gaudi buildings, a pile of restaurants, and lots of designer shops (we're a family of four women and one unfortunate father, so this went down well.) The Hotel is in two parts - the old and the new - but you wouldn't really know the difference, they're both bright, airy and modern. Our rooms were in the old building. They were spacious, and not too loud even though they were right by the street. Air conditioning was great. Beds were SO comfortable, The pillows were also great (I know that sounds a tad odd, but they were). Bathrooms were also lovely, spacious too. Plenty of hot water and towels, shampoo, conditioner...etc. Plenty of space for clothes and even a little safe for your valuables. We had two rooms - one with a double bed, one with two singles, and each had a little balcony. The staff were wonderful. When we arrived at the hotel, we went into the new building (which has a green staircase), but were told that our rooms were in the "old" building, because of the noise levels caused by renovations. This threw us slightly at first, but the "old" building was about ten seconds away, and and far from old. (this one has a stone staircase) There's lots of space to sit down and relax in the lobby, and even a baby grand piano which - much to our delight - we were allowed play during the day. Brekfast in the morning (in the "new" building) was lovely. A nice buffet table, so you could pick and choose whatever you wanted from rashers to fresh fruit. The terrace in the "old" building is just lovely. It has bar service, and you can see the city at night - but also into the rooms across the street. I'd watch out for that if you're ever staying in the "new" building. Price wise, we thought it was expensive - But well worth it, because staying there was a real treat. So what's wrong with it? The swimming pool, which we nicknamed "the sitting puddle." It's tiny. 9 X 13 feet. The solarium was 20 X 30 feet. This really made no difference to us, because we spent most of our time sight seeing, but if you want an actual pool, this place doesn't have it - at least, not in the "old" building. Just one last thing, it's as cheap to get a taxi from the city airport to town as any other way - €23 for four of us. Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first thing we discovered was there are two buildings - the old and the new. We had booked this hotel because of it's great location and because it had free internet access in-room and a small outdoor pool. We checked in and were met with a flustered front desk person, followed by a gesture that we were in the 'other' building across the street (the one with no pool). We clarified that we could still use the pool, so that was OK. Next, we needed the password for the internet access. That's when we discovered that you actually only get 1 hour per day of access in the lobby. If you want internet in your room, they charge an outrageous amount per 24 hour period. We went to talk to the front desk - waited a full half hour, got what we thought was a Manager, who 'checked our story' on the website while we waited - only to see for herself that there is no mention of internet service surcharges. She had to ask her Manager and would call us in 10 minutes. An hour later, we went to find her Manager - got a 'Front Desk Manager' who argued the fine points and the fact that not all hotels say they surcharge for internet access, but many actually do charge. He wouldn't give in, so we asked to speak to the Manager (so many managers and yet such poor service). He couldn't accommodate us, but said we should ask him at the end of the day what their decision was. Ultimately, the 'best offer' was half price for internet access, which we took because we needed it. So, long story short - a great location, OK room and terrible service that actually seems to forget that service is what they are supposed to provide. End of story. Won't be back to this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in late May. This is an average business hotel, nothing more. Rooms on the road side (Passeig de Gracia) are very noisy. Location is very central for some good shopping, but the hotel's common areas are quite dull and the staff aren't particulary welcoming. There are better hotels and certainly better value hotels in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Indy
Reviews.Content: Based largely upon the reviews we read here on Tripadvisor we booked four nights in late March of this year at the Condes de Barcelona. There were absolutely NO surprises - this site really works! If there are enough responses, you can get a good feel for what a hotel is really like (can see through the mindless positives, the whiner negatives, and identify those who are giving you the straight stuff). So, ... our feedback regarding the Condes de Barcelona is that it is a tremendous value, smack dab in the hottest section of the Eixample. The hotel is fairly luxurious - not the Ritz, but all of the linens, wall coverings, and floorings were in "new" condition. The service was very good; not the highly anticipatory graciousness of the top flite hotels, but very attentive and responsive. The rooms are relatively large for Barcelona, and exceptionally clean (very important to us) and modern in appearance. Based upon some of the reviews we'd read here, we requested a room in the main building - not the newly acquired annex across the street - and one with a balcony, preferably away from the street (the very busy Passeig de Gracia). They complied, and we were most satisfied. The hotel is situated between two of Antonin Gaudi's better known works in town: La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. As well, much of the high end shopping in Barcelona is within blocks of the hotel. And the exceptional Barcelona Metro System has two stops within two blocks of the Condes de Barcelona. The entrance is a nice marble trimmed affair; but the kicker is the winding staircase rising from the main lobby. This marble staircase is trimmed in Gaudi ironwork. And the public areas AND rooms are trimmed in very rich hardwoods, which complement the marble and ironwork very nicely. The architectural detail was a very nice surprise. The main hotel building has a nice rooftop terrace overlooking the Passeig de Gracia and La Pedrera, a nice place to unwind of an evening. Breakfast is served in the annex, and is a decent layout - albeit too pricey for our taste, particularly with several very fine pasteria's within a block. The price was the kicker. We would have expected to pay about 50 to 100 euros more for a hotel with the appointments, service, and location of the Condes de Barcelona. I've stayed in Barcelona four times now, and this was easily my favorite hotel to-date. Dave in Indy

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: preppride1798
Reviews.Content: We were also placed in the new extention, but did not mind it one bit. The extention is new, clean and tastefully decorated. The room was huge by european standards. The hotel is the center of all the upscale shopping and walking distance to a number of Gudi buildings. A very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 6 nights in August and found it very pleasant (and great deal for $150 a night which is below the regular price we have seen). Note that the rooms facing the inner patio in the new building might be claustrophobic – very little natural light and no fresh air. We upgraded to a room with a balcony (have in mind that the street is too noisy to keep the doors open). Both rooms we used had been in great shape – we loved the hardwood floor! If you can get it for the prices we did, don’t hesitate. The walk to the old city is too long to come for an afternoon nap and walk back for dinner… Do not miss Cerveceria Catalana nearby (Mallorca, 236) for eating – note that it is getting crowded after 8pm and you will have to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Disappionted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently booked a 4 night stay to celebrate my wife's birthday(Nov 11th-15th). On arrival we were allocated a room in the newer building.The property was nice but due to the fact all the facilities were in the other building it made the hotel feel soleless and unlived in. No where to relax and enjoy a coffee or a drink,no oppurtunities to meet other guests. Room was adequate but small,air conditioning very poor and due the annoying fact we had no window to the outside the heat and lack of Fresh air was eveident and uncomfortable. The window in our bedroom actually faced into a chimney type void stretching from ground to roof,possibly an old courtyard at ground level. Would certainly not stay at this hotel again and to give it 4 stars is way of line. Despite hotel problems we enjoyed our stay in what is a lovely city
